139.description: To establish a time frame for a mortgage company to pay or endorse payment to a borrower for a covered claim that is made jointly to the borrower and the mortgage company.

141.description: To require an insurer, health care center, managed care organization or other entity that delivers, issues for delivery, renews, amends or continues a health insurance policy or medical benefits plan to include the name of an enrollee's primary care provider on any identification card issued to the enrollee for such policy or plan.

142.description: To require insurers that provide coverage to a food establishment for spoilage of perishable food to cover to the same extent perishable food that such establishment donates to an emergency shelter, and to extend immunity to such establishments for such donation.

143.description: To change existing funding initiatives for the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities at the local level.

144.title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Sentencing Commission Regarding The Classification Of Unclassified Misdemeanors.
144.description: To adopt the recommendations of the Sentencing Commission regarding the classification of unclassified misdemeanors.

145.description: To require attorneys to indicate on the annual attorney registration form whether they maintain professional liability insurance and require the Judicial Branch to indicate on its Internet web site the insurance status of each attorney who has submitted such form.

146.description: To clarify that notaries public may not (1) offer legal assistance in immigration matters unless they are attorneys or otherwise permitted to provide assistance in such matters pursuant to federal law; or (2) falsely convey the impression that they are attorneys by use of certain titles.

147.description: To permit a person convicted of a motor vehicle offense that resulted in the death or serious physical injury of another person to express sympathy, fault, condolence or similar sentiment to the victim or family members of the victim in open court, without such expression being admissible as evidence against such person.

148.description: To increase the amount of compensation an attorney who does not engage in the practice of law as an occupation can receive in legal fees or related compensation and remain exempt from the occupational tax on attorneys.

149.title: An Act Concerning The Connecticut Uniform Adult Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act.
149.description: To adopt the Connecticut Uniform Adult Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act.

150.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Labor and Public Employees
150.title: An Act Concerning Unemployment Benefits As A Subsidy To The Salary Of A New Employee.
150.description: To encourage hiring by allowing unemployment benefits to be used as a subsidy for the salary of a person at a new job.

151.title: An Act Concerning The Applicability Of The Prevailing Wage To Existing And Future Public Works Projects.
151.description: To eliminate the prevailing wage threshold on public works projects that are not federally funded.

152.title: An Act Concerning The Labor Department's Youth Employment Program.
152.description: To provide additional funds for youth employment programs.

153.title: An Act Concerning Planning Regions.

155.description: To require the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee to study ways in which municipalities may provide property tax relief.

156.description: To permit, rather than to require, an animal control officer to quarantine a dog, cat or other animal in a public pound when such animal has attacked or bitten a person who was not on the premises of the owner of such animal.

157.description: To provide for the assessment of buildings and improvements that are partially completed or under construction.

158.title: An Act Concerning Regional Plans Of Conservation And Development.
158.description: To revise a statute concerning the state plan of conservation and development.

159.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding

159.description: To authorize municipalities to abate property taxes for small businesses.

160.description: To ensure that state funds derived from the Tobacco Settlement Fund and taxes on tobacco products are allocated to programs that ameliorate the ill effects of such products.

162.description: To revise Department of Transportation statutes.

167.description: To require licensed automobile dealers to complete a safety inspection form before selling a used vehicle and to allow a mechanism for a dealer to sell a vehicle in "as is" condition.

168.description: To amend certain motor vehicle statutes to replace the term "learner's permit" with "instruction permit", to establish an adult instruction permit and to remove the fee for four-year licenses, which the department no longer issues.

169.description: To replace the existing State Traffic Commission with the Office of the State Traffic Administration.

234.description: To provide an employee or former employee the right to copy their personnel files and require employers to provide copies of any documented discipline notices and copies of statements notifying an employee of their right to dispute certain documents in their personnel file.

235.description: To add volunteer fire departments and ambulance companies to the definition of "employer" under the Occupational Safety and Health Act.

238.description: To allow the disclosure of performance evaluations of members of the State Board of Labor Relations and the State Board of Mediation and Arbitration to certain individuals.

239.description: To require twice the full amount of wages recovered by an employee or labor organization be awarded in a successful civil action to recover wages an employer has failed to pay.

263.description: To provide bond funds to the West Haven Center for the Arts.

264.title: An Act Concerning Small Business Lending.
264.description: To support small business financing and growth.

265.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Shakespeare Theatre In Stratford.
265.description: To provide funds to the Shakespeare Theatre in Stratford for improvements and renovations.

266.title: An Act Concerning Economic Development And Tax Revenue.
266.description: To allow the city of Waterbury to establish a special taxing district in its central business district.

267.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
267.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Greenway Project.
267.description: To authorize bonds of the state for a grant-in-aid for the greenway project in Waterbury.

268.title: An Act Concerning Reporting Requirements And Enforcing Job Creation Commitments On Certain State-sponsored Projects.
268.description: To require business development projects participating in the First Five Plus program to maintain certain jobs for twelve calendar months and to require certain reports from the Department of Economic and Community Development related to investments of ten million dollars or more in a single project or program.

269.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
269.title: An Act Concerning The Development Of A Model Curriculum Regarding Fiscal Literacy.
269.description: To increase fiscal literacy among high school students by developing a model curriculum regarding fiscal literacy for use in public high schools.

270.title: An Act Concerning The Siting Council.
270.description: To make changes to the Connecticut Siting Council's procedures, including those related to the siting of certain facilities.

271.title: An Act Concerning Energy Infrastructure.
271.description: To determine how to continue the development of renewable technologies in the state.

272.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
272.title: An Act Concerning Collection And Remittance Of The Hotel Tax By Room Remarketers.
272.description: To ensure that sales tax is being paid on the full price a consumer pays to rent a hotel room, including that portion of the rent that is added on by a room remarketer in excess of the rent received by the hotel.

273.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
273.title: An Act Requiring Sales Tax Escrow Accounts.
273.description: To reduce the delinquency rates for the payment of sales tax returns.

274.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
274.title: An Act Concerning An Exemption From The Sales Tax For Environmental Services Provided To Businesses.
274.description: To remove the sales tax on environmental services to businesses, including cleanup of hazardous spills, evaluation of contamination and similar services, in order to prevent loss of business in such services to other states.

275.title: An Act Concerning The Capitol Scholarship Grant Program.
275.description: To eliminate the provision that restricts new, incoming students in certain academic years from receiving financial assistance under the capitol scholarship grant program.

276.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Judiciary
276.title: An Act Concerning The Indemnification Of University Police.
276.description: To require indemnification of special police force officers.

277.title: An Act Concerning Dual Enrollment Opportunities.
277.description: To identify and facilitate dual enrollment opportunities for secondary school students participating in a career cluster curriculum.

278.title: An Act Concerning Public Institutions Of Higher Education.
278.description: To conform the purchasing statute governing public institutions of higher education with the current practice of and statutory framework regarding advertising for competitive bids and proposals for goods and services on the part of the Department of Administrative Services; to require that the audit of faculty consulting agreements occur on an annual, rather than a seminannual, basis; to eliminate the requirement that independent auditors estimate the book value of The University of Connecticut Health Center's patient account receivables; and to require the automatic vesting of title to inventions in The University of Connecticut in certain circumstances.

279.title: An Act Adjusting Nursing Home Rates For Physical Plant Improvements.
279.description: To adjust Medicaid rates for nursing facilities that made physical plant improvements or replaced furniture and equipment between 2008 and 2011.

280.title: An Act Concerning Fraud Detection In Social Services Programs.
280.description: To expand efforts to fight fraud and abuse in taxpayer-supported social services programs.

281.title: An Act Adjusting Income Eligibility For Medicare Savings Programs.
281.description: To align income eligibility guidelines among programs for senior citizens.

282.title: An Act Waiving Advance Payment Restrictions For Certain Nursing Facilities.
282.description: To allow for the waiver of restrictions on advance payments for nursing facilities in receivership.

283.title: An Act Concerning Recoupment Of State Assistance Payments.
283.description: To clarify third-party and health plan obligations regarding payment and recoupment of state assistance payments.

284.title: An Act Adjusting Community Health Center Rates For Capital Investments.
284.description: To adjust rates paid by the state to community health centers for capital investments made by the centers.

285.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Public Safety and Security
285.title: An Act Concerning The Return Of Stolen Property.
285.description: To permit more stolen property recovered by police to be returned to the rightful owner by raising the property value threshold that determines whether the police must file an inventory and retain the property.

286.title: An Act Concerning The Appointment Of A Guardian Ad Litem For A Person Who Is Subject To A Conservatorship Proceeding Or A Proceeding Concerning Administration Of Treatment For A Psychiatric Disability.
286.description: To provide that: (1) A person who is subject to a conservatorship proceeding or a proceeding concerning administration of treatment for a psychiatric disability shall not be appointed a guardian ad litem prior to a determination that such person is incapacitated, and (2) such appointment be made for limited purposes and duration established by the court.

287.title: An Act Concerning Children Of Incarcerated Women.
287.description: To study the feasibility, costs and benefits of establishing a nursery facility at the Connecticut Correctional Institution, Niantic, for the purpose of caring for children born to women during their detention at such institution.

288.title: An Act Increasing The Penalty For Subsequent Offenses Of Cruelty To Animals.
288.description: To classify a second or subsequent offense of cruelty to an animal as a felony punishable by a fine of not more than five thousand dollars or imprisonment of not more than five years, or both.

289.title: An Act Concerning The Leasing Of Judicial Branch Facilities.
289.description: To authorize the Judicial Branch to lease its own facilities.

290.title: An Act Concerning The Minimum Wage.
290.description: To raise the minimum wage and base future raises on the consumer price index, remove the tip credit, and increase penalties for failure to pay the minimum wage.

291.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health
291.title: An Act Concerning Bonding To Benefit Redemption Song, Inc.
291.description: To improve recovery rates and maintain family connections by allocating bond funds for the acquisition or rental of supportive sober housing for parents attending the Dry Dock recovery program in Wallingford.

292.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health
292.title: An Act Concerning Funding For Certain Municipal Health Departments.
292.description: To provide funding for full-time health departments in municipalities with populations of less than fifty thousand.

293.last_action: Senate Recommitted to Public Safety and Security
293.title: An Act Concerning Lateral Certification Of Police Officers.
293.description: To clarify that certified police officers who seek employment with a different police department do not have to take and pass a physical fitness test.

294.title: An Act Concerning Eligibility Requirements For Employment As A Police Officer.
294.description: To allow a person who has had a criminal conviction in another state removed as a barrier to employment as a police officer in that state, and who has served as a police officer in that state, to qualify as a candidate to be a police officer in this state.

295.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Higher Education and Employment Advancement
295.title: An Act Concerning Course Enrollment Fee Waivers For Certain Veterans, Members Of The National Guard And Their Dependants Enrolled At Charter Oak State College.
295.description: To waive the payment of tuition for certain veterans and members of the National Guard enrolled at Charter Oak State College.

296.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Substitution Of State Licensing Requirements With Military Occupational Specialty Training For Veterans.
296.description: To establish a task force to study the use of military occupational specialty training as a substitute for state licensing requirements.

297.title: An Act Concerning Fundraising By Veterans' Organizations.
297.description: To establish and make public a list of reputable veterans' charitable organizations.

299.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health
299.title: An Act Concerning Licensing For Manicuring Services.
299.description: To protect public safety and reduce the workload of local health departments who must deal with a significant number of unlicensed facilities and the lack of a standardized training program and inspection criteria by the Department of Public Health.

300.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
300.title: An Act Adjusting Income Eligibility Guidelines For Medicare Savings Programs.
300.description: An Act Adjusting Income Eligibility Guidelines For Medicare Savings Programs.

301.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
301.title: An Act Concerning Municipalities And Solid Waste Facilities.
301.description: An Act Concerning Municipalities And Solid Waste Facilities.

302.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
302.title: An Act Concerning The Exemption From Disclosure Of Certain Addresses Under The Freedom Of Information Act.
302.description: An Act Concerning The Exemption From Disclosure Of Certain Addresses Under The Freedom Of Information Act.

303.title: An Act Concerning The Training And Authority Of Certain Constables Appointed For Fish And Game Protection.
303.description: To provide funding for the Turn In Poachers program and the lobster restoration program.

304.title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Bamboo Stakes To Mark Shellfish Grounds.
304.description: To improve water safety by prohibiting the use of bamboo stakes to mark shellfish grounds.

305.title: An Act Requiring The Licensing Of Certain Landscaping Companies.
305.description: To protect the public by requiring certain landscaping companies to be licensed.

306.title: An Act Concerning Registered Interior Designers.
306.description: To remove an outdated restriction placed on registered interior designers.

307.title: An Act Concerning The Board In Control Of The Connecticut Agricultural Experiment Station.
307.description: To permit the president or vice-president of the board in control of the Connecticut Agricultural Experiment Station to excuse absences of members of the board.

308.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Creation Of A Governance Structure To Implement E-government.
308.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning the establishment of an E-Government Board, the development and implementation of a strategic e-government plan, the development of a marketing strategy concerning the state central Internet web site and the development of an on-line user survey concerning said web site.

309.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of Methods To Reduce The State's Software Licensing Costs.
309.description: To require the Department of Administrative Services to conduct a study concerning methods for the state to reduce its software licensing costs.

310.title: An Act Concerning Public Works Projects That Are Privately Funded.
310.description: To clarify that the prevailing wage requirement only applies when a public works project is funded by public funds.

311.title: An Act Creating A Process For Family Child Care Providers And Personal Care Attendants To Collectively Bargain With The State.
311.description: To make changes in the state employee health benefit statutes to correspond with employee concessions in the state employee collective bargaining agreement.

312.title: An Act Creating A Task Force To Study The Need For A Public Retirement Plan.
312.description: To create a task force to study a state-administered defined benefit plan for employees of employers in the state.

313.title: An Act Concerning The Jeopardy Collection Of Taxes.
313.description: To require a tax collector to provide written notice to the chief executive officer or chief elected official of a municipality and to the taxpayer upon commencing a jeopardy tax collection proceeding.

314.title: An Act Authorizing Planning Commissions To Notify Regional Planning Agencies Of Subdivision Applications By Electronic Mail.
314.description: To authorize municipal planning commissions to send notice of certain proposed subdivisions by electronic mail to regional planning agencies and to make technical changes for internal consistency.

315.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations
315.title: An Act Requiring A Two-thirds Vote Of The General Assembly To Enlarge Municipal Mandates And Authorizing A Review Of Certain Municipal Budgets.
315.description: To require two-thirds of each chamber of the General Assembly to pass a municipal mandate and to require the Auditors of Public Accounts to conduct an audit of certain municipalities that receive more than thirty-five per cent of their operating budgets as state grants-in-aid.

316.title: An Act Concerning Annual Adjustments To Assessment Rates Adopted For Apartment And Residential Properties.
316.description: To provide municipalities with a local option to charge interest on delinquent property taxes at a rate of twelve per cent per annum, and to amend the manner in which interest on such delinquent property taxes is calculated so that a payment that is only delinquent for a fraction of a month shall not be charged interest for a full month.

317.title: An Act Concerning The Revision Of Municipal Charters.
317.description: To provide that after October 1, 2012, charter commissions, charter revision commissions and home rule ordinance revision commissions may only consider changes to charters and home rule ordinances recommended by the appointing authority or by petition unless a charter or home rule ordinance has not been comprehensively reviewed in twelve or more years.

318.title: An Act Concerning Persons Aggrieved By Decisions Of Municipal Land Use Boards And The Penalties For Violating Municipal Blight Ordinances.
318.description: To increase the applicable fines for violations of municipal blight ordinances.

319.title: An Act Concerning Bonds And Other Surety For Approved Site Plans And Subdivisions.
319.description: To amend requirements concerning the posting of bonds and other surety for the completion of public improvements on approved site plans and subdivisions, and to prohibit municipalities from regulating the issuance of building permits for structures built pursuant to an approved site plan or subdivision and located on a lot abutting an unaccepted highway or street.

320.title: An Act Concerning The Office Of Health Care Access.
320.description: To make changes to various public health statutes involving the Office of Health Care Access.

321.title: An Act Concerning Pressure-redistribution Mattresses And Patient Care In Nursing Home Facilities.
321.description: To require nursing homes to use pressure redistribution mattresses to help prevent residents from getting pressure ulcers.

322.title: An Act Concerning Biting Dogs.
322.description: To provide additional options for animal control officers to respond to incidents of attacks or biting by dogs.

323.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Environment
323.title: An Act Concerning Child Safety By Restricting The Placement Of Leghold Traps.
323.description: To restrict the placement of leghold traps within one thousand five hundred feet of areas where children are likely to encounter such devices.

324.title: An Act Concerning Children And Youth.
324.description: To require a study of government organization providing services to children and youth.

325.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Encourage The Purchase Of Food Products Grown Or Made In Connecticut.
325.description: To allow consumers to make informed decisions regarding the purchase of food products.

326.title: An Act Concerning Professional Licenses.
326.description: To shorten the amount of time in which professional and occupational license applications are processed by the Department of Consumer Protection.

327.title: An Act Establishing A Fine Art Secured Lending License.
327.description: To establish a fine art secured lender license.

328.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Telepharmacy By Hospitals.
328.description: To enable Connecticut hospitals to use telepharmacy for the dispensing of sterile products.

329.title: An Act Concerning Sexual Offender Registration Requirements For Certain Persons Granted Temporary Leave By The Psychiatric Security Review Board And The Establishment Of An Acquitee Information Internet Web Site.
329.description: To require a person found not guilty of a sexual offense by reason of mental disease or defect who is granted temporary leave to a residential setting by the Psychiatric Security Review Board to register as a sexual offender with the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection.

330.title: An Act Concerning The Uniform Interstate Depositions And Discovery Act.
330.description: To enact the Uniform Interstate Depositions and Discovery Act in this state.

331.title: An Act Concerning Smoking In Public Buildings And The Exemption For Tobacco Bars.
331.description: To redefine a tobacco bar and reduce smoking in public places.

332.last_action: House Adopted House Amendment Schedule A 4057
332.title: An Act Concerning Organ And Tissue Donation Awareness.
332.description: To increase education and awareness of organ and tissue donation.

333.title: An Act Concerning The Sale Or Abandonment Of Water Supply Sources And Associated Land.
333.description: To clarify procedures concerning the sale, abandonment or alienation of a water supply source or potential water supply source and land associated with the water supply source.

334.title: An Act Concerning Lyme Disease Testing.
334.description: To establish a task force to study Lyme disease testing.

335.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations
335.title: An Act Increasing Funding For Elderly Nutrition.
335.description: To increase funding for the elderly nutrition program.

336.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Evaluate The Utility Of Creating A Public Retirement Plan.
336.description: To create a task force to study the need for a public retirement plan.

337.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations
337.title: An Act Concerning Medicaid Long-term Care Coverage For Married Couples.
337.description: To allow the spouse of an institutionalized individual seeking Medicaid benefits to keep the maximum community spouse protected amount, as determined by federal law.

338.title: An Act Extending The Reporting Requirements For And Expanding The Membership Of The Task Force To Study The Distribution Of State Funds To Municipalities.
338.description: To extend the time for the task force to study the distribution of state funds to municipalities to issue its report and to expand the membership of said task force.

339.title: An Act Establishing An Energy-related Jobs Task Force.
339.description: To convene a task force to study the state's current and potential green jobs industry and corresponding workforce.

340.title: An Act Concerning Additional Business Rights Related To Zoning Enforcements.
340.description: To provide more transparency and notice of the zoning enforcement process to applicants seeking a building permit or certificate of occupancy.

341.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The State's Brownfield Remediation And Development Statutes.
341.description: To clarify that targeted brownfield loans may be used for affordable housing projects.

342.title: An Act Concerning Economic Development Through Streamlined And Improved Brownfield Remediation Programs, Exempting Certain Airport Conveyances From The Department Of Transportation To The Connecticut Airport Authority From The Hazardous Waste Establishment Transfer Act, And Holding Harmless And Indemnifying The Connecticut Airport Authority And Its Employees And Directors.
342.description: To empower the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to perform an in-depth analysis of the state's brownfield remediation and development programs and recommend changes to such programs.

343.title: An Act Concerning Streamlining The State's Stormwater General Permitting Process.
343.description: To streamline the state's stormwater general permitting process.

344.title: An Act Concerning The Powers Of Certain Agents And Officers Of The United States Secret Service.
344.description: To grant to agents and officers of the United States Secret Service some of the powers and protections granted to peace officers in this state.

345.title: An Act Concerning Minor And Technical Revisions To Statutes Affecting Children And Youth.
345.description: To make minor and technical revisions to statutes affecting children and youth.

346.title: An Act Concerning The Reporting Of Children Placed In Seclusion.
346.description: To require the State Board of Education to produce an annual summary report identifying the frequency of use of physical restraint and seclusion on children and provide such report to the Select Committee on Children.

347.title: An Act Concerning The Administration Of Medicine To Students With Diabetes, The Duties Of School Medical Advisors, The Availability Of Cpr And Aed Training Materials For Boards Of Education And Physical Exercise During The School Day.
347.description: To require local and regional boards of education to appoint an appropriate number of school nurses for the district that promotes a healthy learning environment; to establish the School Nurse Professional Development Advisory Council; and to amend the duties of school medical advisors.

348.title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of Cpr And Aed Training In The Public School Curriculum.
348.description: To include CPR and AED training in the prescribed courses of study in the public school curriculum.

349.title: An Act Concerning The Expansion Of The Pilot Study Of Best Practices In Early Literacy And Closing Academic Achievement Gaps.
349.description: To establish a reading program that improves the reading skills of students in kindergarten to grade three, inclusive.

350.title: An Act Concerning Vocational-technical Schools.
350.description: To rename the regional vocational-technical high school system to the technical high school system, to establish a technical high school system board, to amend the budget adoption process for the technical high school system, to clarify the responsibilities of the superintendent of the technical high school system and to make conforming changes.

351.title: An Act Concerning The Study Of Personalized Learning Schools.
351.description: To promote the personalization of student learning by establishing a pilot program to provide grants to school districts to develop personalized systems of learning, authorizing the Commissioner of Education to develop assessments to be used to determine eligible credits for satisfying the high school graduation requirements, and to establish a personalized assessment system that develops various models of state examinations.

352.title: An Act Concerning Individualized Education Programs And Other Issues Relating To Special Education.
352.description: To improve the dissemination and communication of information regarding individualized education programs to parents and guardians and to improve the quality of education for teachers in the implementation of individualized education programs; to require that any special education services provided by a school district to a student whose parents have chosen to send him or her to a private school comply with the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Act; to require that the state special education excess cost grant goes to the district that is financially responsible for paying the tuition costs for a child; and to make technical corrections to the general statutes.

353.title: An Act Concerning Athletic Directors And Incorporating Physical Activity Into The School Day.
353.description: To require persons employed as athletic directors to hold appropriate certification and to require at least twenty minutes of physical exercise per school day for students in grades kindergarten to five, inclusive.

354.title: An Act Concerning Museum Property.
354.description: To provide Connecticut museums, libraries and archives a means to establish clear title to property in their possession.

355.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
355.title: An Act Concerning Bridges Between Public Schools And Institutions Of Higher Education.
355.description: To improve college preparedness by aligning high school and college curricula by establishing a pilot program that requires each priority school district to partner with a public institution of higher education to evaluate and align curricula based on Connecticut's common core state standards and to test students and assess the results to determine college readiness.

356.title: An Act Concerning A Deaf Child Bill Of Rights.
356.description: To require the individualized education program for a child who is deaf or hearing impaired to include a language and communication plan.

357.title: An Act Concerning Authorization Of State Grant Commitments For School Building Projects And Concerning Changes To The Statutes Concerning School Building Projects.
357.description: To authorize state grant commitments for school building projects.

358.title: An Act Requiring Pharmacies To Verify The Identity Of Persons Making Telephonic Prescription Requests.
358.description: To require pharmacies to verify the identity of persons making prescription requests.

359.title: An Act Prohibiting Certain Persons From Allowing Minors To Possess Alcoholic Liquor In Dwelling Units And On Private Property.
359.description: To protect the health and safety of persons under the age of eighteen and to prohibit certain persons from allowing minors to possess alcoholic liquor in dwelling units or on private property.

360.title: An Act Prohibiting The Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority From Retaining A Municipal Liaison.
360.description: To prohibit the Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority from retaining a municipal liaison.

361.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
361.title: An Act Concerning A Deduction From The Personal Income Tax For Student Loan Interest.
361.description: To establish a deduction from the personal income tax for interest paid on student loans.

362.title: An Act Concerning Interviews Of Children By The Department Of Children And Families During Investigations Of Child Abuse And Neglect.
362.description: To clarify when it is permissible for the Department of Children and Families to interview a child without the consent of the child's parent or guardian.

363.title: An Act Concerning The Definition Of "notarial Act".
363.description: To clarify the types of acts performed by notaries public which are included in the definition of "notarial act".

364.title: An Act Concerning Court Operations And Victim Services.
364.description: To make statutory changes necessitated by the expansion of the judicial performance evaluation program to Judge Trial Referees; allow the Judicial Marshal Academy to provide training to a broader range of security training; provide an enforcement mechanism for the payment of certain fees; clarify that twenty-five per cent of the fine imposed for a cell phone violation is distributed to municipalities; make revisions to various summary process-related statutes; authorize clerks to give notice of court orders and decrees by computer, facsimile or other technology; include trustees appointed by the court within the definition of "state officers and employees" for purposes of representation and indemnification; authorize prosecutors and defendants to reach agreement as to amounts to be paid for infractions and violations and process such payments as "bond forfeitures"; eliminate obsolete references to the Community Court "pilot program"; make minor changes to Supreme Court's procedures; add state identification card holders to the jury pool; conform the provisions regarding dismissal of alternate jurors in civil cases to that in criminal cases; allow any proper amendment upon payment of taxable costs; clarify the application of certain statutes to persons convicted of a motor vehicle violation for which a sentence of at least one year imprisonment may be imposed; add the pretrial supervisory diversionary program for persons with psychiatric disabilities to the bail bond termination statute; require that a motion be filed in order for a nolle to enter when a case has been continued at the request of the prosecutor for thirteen months; add a reference to the municipal fee to enable the Judicial Branch to process that fee uniformly; make technical corrections to the Office of Victim Services' powers and duties; revise victim compensation provisions to include situations where disclosures of sexual assault or risk of injury are made to individuals, but no police report is made; eliminate the $100 deductible on victim compensation; clarify that Office of Victim Services is entitled to recoupment of certain funds paid when the victim subsequently receives compensation from another source for the same incident; clarify the Connecticut courts can enter dissolutions of civil unions that have been entered in other states; to specify persons who may access the information contained in alternative sentencing plans or community release plans; to clarify the functions performed by intake, assessment and referral specialists employed by the Judicial Branch; and repeal obsolete sections pertaining to Messengers of the Supreme and Appellate Court and the pleading of demurrers.

365.title: An Act Concerning Civil Actions And Subpoenas Filed To Harass An Individual Or After Numerous Actions Against The Individual Have Been Dismissed.
365.description: To protect crime victims, and individuals against whom multiple civil actions have been filed and dismissed, by establishing standards for plaintiffs who initiate civil actions against such victims and individuals, and to make standards concerning subpoenas in civil actions against crime victims applicable to all plaintiffs, rather than limiting such provisions to pro se litigants as currently provided.

366.title: An Act Concerning Competency To Stand Trial.
366.description: To: (1) Allow the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services and the Department of Correction to coordinate the custody and treatment of a defendant who presents a significant security, safety or medical risk, and (2) allow a court to receive notice if a defendant is released from commitment to the Commissioner of Developmental Services prior to the expiration of the statute of limitations for the crime with which the defendant was charged.

367.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
367.title: An Act Concerning The Modernization Of The State's Taxicab Industry.
367.description: To update the state's taxicab statutes.

368.title: An Act Implementing A Natural Gas Vehicle Pilot Program For Municipal Fleets.
368.description: To establish a municipal natural gas vehicle pilot program.

369.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
369.title: An Act Concerning Changes To The Local Bridge Program.
369.description: To increase the municipal reimbursement rate and make other changes to the local bridge program to encourage participation in such program and reduce the number of deficient municipal bridges.

370.title: An Act Concerning Drivers' Schools.
370.description: To streamline Department of Motor Vehicles' services and reduce costs by renewing drivers' school instructors' licenses biennially instead of annually.

371.title: An Act Concerning Parking Placards.
371.description: To require the Department of Motor Vehicles to put the photograph of a person issued a removable windshield placard for people who are blind or disabled on such placard.

372.title: An Act Waiving The Commercial Driver's License Knowledge And Skills Test For Veterans With Equivalent Military Licenses.
372.description: To increase job opportunities available to veterans by allowing an exemption from the commercial driver's license skills and knowledge test for veterans with an equivalent military license.

373.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
373.title: An Act Establishing A Veterans' Foster Home Pilot Program.
373.description: To increase transitional housing opportunities available to homeless veterans and their families by providing tax incentives to sponsors who provide such transitional housing.

374.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
374.title: An Act Concerning The Municipal Property Tax Exemption For Certain Veterans.
374.description: To increase municipal property tax exemptions available to veterans and their heirs and to require the state to refund municipalities for property tax losses associated with these exemptions.

375.title: An Act Concerning Constables For Fish And Game Protection And The Possession Of Firearms On School Grounds.
375.description: To permit municipal constables for fish and game protection to perform their duties after receiving abbreviated training from a certified officer at their local police department and to authorize peace officers to possess firearms on school grounds while off duty.

376.title: An Act Prohibiting The Use Of Animals, Reptiles Or Birds As Prizes At Bazaars Or Carnivals Or As Raffle Prizes.
376.description: To prohibit animals, reptiles and birds being awarded as raffle prizes or at bazaars and carnivals.

377.title: An Act Concerning The Maximum Surcharge For Enhanced 9-1-1 Service.
377.description: To determine the appropriate maximum monthly fee that the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority may require providers of local telephone service, commercial mobile radio service, voice over Internet protocol service and prepaid wireless telephone service to assess their subscribers to fund the development and administration of the enhanced emergency 9-1-1 program.

378.last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
378.title: An Act Concerning Funding For Police Training.
378.description: To ensure that funds collected for municipal police training purposes from certain motor vehicle violations are directed to defraying the cost of that training.

379.title: An Act Requiring The Display Of House Numbers.
379.description: To require homeowners to prominently display the house number assigned to their home.

380.title: An Act Concerning The Implementation Of The Public Safety Answering Point Consolidation Feasibility Study.
380.description: To achieve financial and operational efficiencies in the handling of emergency 9-1-1 calls.

381.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Judiciary
381.title: An Act Concerning Professional Bondsmen, Surety Bail Bond Agents And Bail Enforcement Agents.
381.description: To establish age and education requirements for professional bondsmen and bail enforcement agents and provide for the revocation of their licenses if a restraining or protective order has been issued against them, require any badges worn by bail enforcement agents to be approved, require annual firearms refresher training for holders of a special firearms permit and require approval of instructors offering criminal justice and firearms courses to applicants.

382.title: An Act Requiring Carbon Monoxide And Oxygen Sensors On Portable Electric Generators.
382.description: To ensure the safety of persons using portable electric generators by requiring such generators to be equipped with sensors that will automatically shut down the generator when it is used in an enclosed space where carbon monoxide levels rise and oxygen levels drop.

383.title: An Act Concerning The Definition Of Terms And Minor Revisions In The Energy, Technology And Utility Statutes.
383.description: To alphabetize the terms in section 16-1 of the general statutes.

384.title: An Act Concerning Energy Retrofits For Certain Buildings And The Disclosure Of The Energy Efficiency Of Certain Buildings.
384.description: To require the disclosure of the energy efficiency of certain buildings and to require energy audits as a condition of certain assistance from the Connecticut Housing Finance Authority.

385.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Insurance Statutes.
385.description: To revise various insurance statutes to clarify and enhance the Insurance Department's regulatory authority.

386.title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Claim Forms And The Development Of A Uniform Treatment Authorization Form For Mental Health Services.
386.description: To allow health care providers to use a National Provider Identifier in lieu of a federal tax identification number on an HCFA1500 payment claim form, and to require the development of a uniform treatment authorization form for mental health services.

387.title: An Act Concerning Court Fees And The Delivery Of Legal Services To The Poor.
387.description: To increase certain court filing fees and allocate sixty per cent of the funds generated to the interest earned on lawyers' clients' funds account to provide legal services to the poor, and allocate the remaining funds to the Judicial Data Processing Revolving Fund to fund technology projects within the Judicial Branch.

388.title: An Act Concerning The Palliative Use Of Marijuana.
388.description: To permit the palliative use of marijuana.

389.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Judiciary
389.title: An Act Concerning Precious Metals Or Stones Dealers.
389.description: To require precious metals or stones dealers to provide a periodic statement of transactions in an electronic format to the local licensing authority and retain any goods purchased for at least ten days, and to make the requirements applicable to precious metal or stones dealers similar to those applicable to secondhand dealers.

390.title: An Act Concerning A Law Enforcement Agency's Use Of An Automated License Plate Recognition System.
390.description: To establish an insurance and vehicle registration system that would use cameras to detect vehicles that are uninsured or unregistered and assess fines on the owners of such vehicles.

391.title: An Act Concerning The State Response To A Declared State Of Emergency.
391.description: To require the development of a state emergency preparedness plan.

392.title: An Act Concerning The Sale Of Law Enforcement Badges.
392.description: To restrict the sale of badges or shields that identify the wearer as holding a specific government office, title or position.

393.title: An Act Concerning Smoke And Carbon Monoxide Detectors And Alarms In Residential Dwellings.
393.description: To require smoke and carbon monoxide detection and warning equipment in all residential buildings.

394.title: An Act Concerning Custody Orders For Deployed Members Of The Armed Forces And Confidential Communications Made To Members Of The Armed Forces Who Are Victim Advocates Or Sexual Assault Prevention Coordinators.
394.description: To protect the best interests of minor children of members of the armed forces by minimizing the disruption caused by deployment.

395.title: An Act Concerning The State Fleet And Mileage, Fuel And Emission Standards.
395.description: To eliminate the minimum gas mileage requirement for cars and light duty trucks purchased as part of the state fleet, to extend by four years the deadline by which one hundred per cent of such vehicles shall be alternative-fueled, hybrid electric or plug-in electric vehicles and to expand the exemption from the mileage, fuel and emission standards to include all law enforcement or emergency response vehicles.

396.title: An Act Concerning The Maximum Amount For Purchases Using The P-card.
396.description: To permit state agencies to use purchasing cards for purchases that exceed ten thousand dollars.

397.title: An Act Modifying Records Retention Requirements For Certain Records In Electronic Form.
397.description: To permit municipalities to retain an electronic copy of certain records rather than requiring the retention of a paper copy for more than ten years.

398.title: An Act Concerning Voluntary Agreements And The Second Injury Fund.
398.description: To clarify the terms under which the Treasurer may settle claims for compensation under the second injury fund.

399.title: An Act Concerning The Municipal Employee Retirement System Contribution Rate.
399.description: To increase the contribution rate for members of the municipal employee retirement system.

400.title: An Act Concerning Leasebacks And The Prevailing Wage Threshold.
400.description: To temporarily raise the prevailing wage threshold for new construction of projects leased or to be leased by the state or a municipality.

401.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Examine Unemployment Compensation.
401.description: To establish a task force to examine unemployment compensation benefits.

402.title: An Act Prohibiting Lobbying By State Employees On State Time.
402.description: To prevent union representatives who are also state employees from engaging in lobbying during the period of time they are being paid to perform services for the state.

403.title: An Act Concerning Retirement Credit For Certain State Employee Veterans.
403.description: To provide an opportunity for individuals who are members of the tier II state employee retirement plan to apply for service credit for prior service in time of war.

404.title: An Act Establishing A State-wide Mill Rate For Motor Vehicles And Amending The Definition Of Antique, Rare Or Special Interest Motor Vehicles.
404.description: To simplify the motor vehicle taxation system, encourage the registration of vehicles and narrow property tax benefits for antique cars.

405.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study Barriers To The Formation Of Municipal Utilities.
405.description: To establish a task force to study legal barriers to the formation of municipal utilities.

406.title: An Act Concerning Performance Standards For Public Utilities.
406.description: To require the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to recommend performance standards for utility companies with the objective of enhancing communication during emergencies.

407.title: An Act Concerning Adoption Fees For Dogs.
407.description: To authorize municipalities that spay or neuter and vaccinate unclaimed dogs to charge any person who adopts an unclaimed dog the cost of such treatments.

408.title: An Act Concerning The Possession Of Certain Animals And Pet Shops And Consumer Reimbursement For Certain Veterinary Expenses.
408.description: To facilitate the reimbursement to consumers for veterinary bills incurred for the care of sick dogs or cats adopted from pet shops, to clarify certain pet shop penalty statutes and to prohibit pet shops from selling dogs and cats obtained from substandard domestic animal mills.

409.title: An Act Transferring The Conservation Functions Of The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection To The Department Of Agriculture.
409.description: To transfer the conservation functions, including forestry, parks and fish and game, from the Department of Environmental Protection to the Department of Agriculture and rename the Department of Agriculture as the Department of Agriculture and Natural Resources.

410.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment
410.title: An Act Authorizing An Agricultural Conservation Easement On The Lands Of The Southbury Training School.
410.description: To permanently preserve certain farmland while enabling the state to retain ownership of such land.

411.title: An Act Concerning The Operation Of Certain Vessels Registered With Marine Dealer Registration Numbers.
411.description: To authorize persons holding United States Coast Guard passenger-for-hire licenses and charter boat registrations to operate vessels registered with marine dealer registration numbers, subject to certain conditions.

412.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Appropriations
412.title: An Act Concerning Invasive Plants.
412.description: To enable the Invasive Plants Council to maintain the services of an invasive plants coordinator.

413.title: An Act Concerning The Elimination Of The Interest Rate Floor For Tax And Insurance Escrow Accounts.
413.description: To eliminate the interest rate floor for tax and insurance escrow accounts.

414.title: An Act Providing Consumer Protection To Clients Of Exchange Facilitators For Tax Deferred Exchanges.
414.description: To require persons and entities to comply with best practices and standards when they facilitate tax deferred exchanges in this state.

415.title: An Act Concerning Credit Card Applications.
415.description: To reduce identity theft by preventing creditors and card issuers from sending prefilled credit card applications to residents of this state.

416.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Insurance and Real Estate
416.title: An Act Concerning Broker Price Opinions For Mortgage Loan Modifications.
416.description: To add mortgagees or mortgagees' agents and attorneys to the list of people to whom a licensed real estate broker or real estate salesperson may provide an estimated valuation of real estate as part of a market analysis.

417.title: An Act Concerning The Modernization Of Certain Banking Statutes.
417.description: To (1) require banks to send notice of a material change in a data processor contract to the Department of Banking, (2) conform requirements concerning appraiser independence with federal requirements set forth in the Federal Truth-in-Lending Act, 15 USC Section 1601 et seq., (3) ensure that any public deposits that are fully insured by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation do not require additional collateral to be pledged against them, (4) eliminate the requirement that, in lieu of eligible collateral, public deposits held by a qualified public depository may be secured solely by an irrevocable letter of credit issued by the Federal Home Loan Bank of Boston, and (5) clarify when regulatory letters require additional collateralization.

418.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
418.title: An Act Concerning Nonrecourse Civil Litigation Purchase Agreements.
418.description: To regulate cash advance contracts and prohibit a cash advance company from charging a consumer a rate of interest on a cash advance contract that is greater than twelve per cent per annum.

419.title: An Act Concerning The Imposition Of The Sales Tax On Room Remarketers.
419.description: To ensure that sales and use tax is being paid for that portion of the rent for a hotel room that is added on by on-line travel service companies that provide hotel rooms at a discounted rate.

420.title: An Act Concerning "zappers".
420.description: To make it a felony to sell, purchase, install, transfer or possess an automated sales suppression device ("zapper") or phantom-ware that eliminates point-of-sale transactions randomly, and creates a shadow record of the sale, making it difficult to detect understated records of sales and sales tax liability.

421.title: An Act Concerning Changes To Statutes Administered By The State Treasurer.
421.description: To require submittal of the required evaluation by a date when more timely information will be available and useful.

422.title: An Act Concerning Oversight Of Large Capital Projects.
422.description: To establish legislative oversight of capital projects that cost fifty million dollars or more.

423.title: An Act Concerning Delays In Revaluation For Certain Towns.
423.description: To provide for a delay in implementing a property revaluation in certain municipalities.

424.title: An Act Concerning The Applicability Of The Sales And Use Tax To Vessel Storage, Maintenance Or Repair.
424.description: To extend the use tax exemption period one additional month for boats brought into Connecticut for storage, maintenance or repair.

425.title: An Act Concerning Reports On Business Tax Credit And Abatement Programs.
425.description: To provide better sources of information for use by the Business Tax Credit and Tax Policy Review Committee.

426.title: An Act Concerning Notice To The Attorney General Of Data Security Breaches Involving The Disclosure Of Personal Information.
426.description: To require that persons who own, license or maintain computerized data that includes personal information immediately notify the Attorney General in the event of a breach of security relating to such data.

427.title: An Act Concerning Residential Stays At Correctional Facilities.
427.description: To allow an inmate to remain in a correctional facility for thirty days beyond the inmate's discharge date while awaiting acceptance into a treatment program or health care institution or for any compelling reason deemed consistent with offender rehabilitation or treatment.

428.title: An Act Prohibiting Disclosure Of The Identities Of Persons Appointed To Administer The Death Penalty.
428.description: To prohibit the disclosure of the identities of persons appointed to administer the death penalty.

429.title: An Act Eliminating The Requirement That There Be Witnesses To A Conveyance Of Land.
429.description: To eliminate the requirement that conveyances of land be attested to by two witnesses and make conforming changes to various provisions of the general statutes.

430.title: An Act Concerning The Confidentiality Of Information Obtained By The Attorney General During The Course Of Antitrust Investigations.
430.description: To conform the Connecticut Antitrust Act with federal antitrust provisions.

431.title: An Act Concerning School-based Arrests.
431.description: To reduce unnecessary school-based arrests by (1) requiring local and regional boards of education to adopt and implement policies concerning the role of law enforcement personnel assigned to schools and (2) improving the public access to data concerning school-based arrests.

432.title: An Act Creating A Procedure For Personal Care Attendants To Collectively Bargain With The State.
432.description: To provide a process for personal care attendants to collectively bargain with the state via the Personal Care Attendant Quality Home Care Workforce Council.

433.title: An Act Concerning The Professional Standard Of Care For Emergency Medical Care Providers.
433.description: To: (1) Provide that a claimant in a medical malpractice action establish the negligence of a health care provider by clear and convincing evidence; and (2) provide that health care providers who render care in emergency departments of acute care hospitals and licensed medical professionals who render emergency care voluntarily and gratuitously be liable for acts or omissions constituting a reckless disregard for the consequences.

434.title: An Act Concerning "do Not Resuscitate" Orders.
434.description: To clarify procedures concerning "do not resuscitate" orders.

435.title: An Act Concerning A Requirement For Water Companies To Conduct Quinquennial Tests On Pressure Vacuum Breakers.
435.description: To require quinquennial tests on pressure vacuum breakers.

436.title: An Act Concerning The Definitions Of Mental Retardation And Intellectual Disability.

437.title: An Act Concerning Payments For Ambulance Services.
437.description: To require payments to ambulance service providers not later than sixty days after services are provided.

438.title: An Act Creating A Task Force To Study Employment Issues Concerning Registries In The Homemaker And Companion Services Industry.
438.description: To designate a homemaker-companion agency, registry or homemaker-home health agency as the employer of individuals providing certain services to consumers for the purposes of unemployment compensation, wages and workers' compensation, and remove liability for such individual's personal injuries arising out of and in the course of employment from the consumer.

439.title: An Act Concerning Visitation Rights For Grandparents And Other Persons.
439.description: To adopt the recommendations of the Task Force to Study Grandparents' Visitation Rights regarding section 46b-59 of the general statutes.

440.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures For Programs And Services Related To Higher Education.
440.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by the Board of Regents for Higher Education, the Office of Financial and Academic Affairs for Higher Education, the board of trustees of The University of Connecticut and the constituent units of higher education.

441.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The General Fund.
441.description: To review appropriations from the General Fund.

442.title: An Act Concerning Benefits For Surviving Spouses Under The Teachers' Retirement System.
442.description: To allow the surviving spouse of a member to elect the benefit under subsection (d) of section 10-183h of the general statutes if the member did not waive the coparticipant's option under section 10-183j of the general statutes while the member was actively teaching.

443.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures For The Programs And Services Of The Department Of Education.
443.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by the Department of Education.

444.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
444.title: An Act Concerning Supplemental Payments Under The Connecticut Energy Assistance Program.
444.description: To review the programs administered by state agencies providing social services.

445.title: An Act Concerning The Payment Procedure For The Sterilization And Vaccination Of Certain Dogs And Cats And Providing For Animal Control Officer Training.
445.description: To allow pounds to complete and retain vouchers for the purpose of payments to veterinarians for the sterilization and vaccination of certain dogs and cats and to require initial training and continuing education for animal control officers.

446.title: An Act Concerning Aquatic Animals As Food And The Taking Of Scallops From The Niantic River.
446.description: To provide for the licensing and inspection of facilities cultivating, processing and supplying aquatic animals in the state for human consumption and to promote scallop production in the Niantic River.

447.title: An Act Concerning English Language Learner Educator Programs In Higher Education.
447.description: To implement the recommendations of the Speaker's English Language Learners Task Force.

448.title: An Act Concerning Performance-based Financial Aid.
448.description: To require the Office of Financial and Academic Affairs for Higher Education to develop a plan for implementing performance-based financial aid programs.

449.title: An Act Establishing A Basic Health Program.
449.description: To establish a basic health program providing coverage for persons under sixty-five years of age with family income up to two hundred per cent of the federal poverty level.

450.title: An Act Concerning Transparency In Nursing Home Cost Reports.
450.description: To increase transparency in nursing home cost reports relating to vendor contracts.

451.title: An Act Concerning The Delivery Of Social Services.
451.description: To increase the number of day care providers eligible to receive Medicaid reimbursement under the Connecticut home care program for the elderly.

452.title: An Act Concerning Domestic Violence And Trauma-informed Care.
452.description: To adopt and define a trauma-informed child and family-serving system in family violence cases.

453.title: An Act Concerning The Valuation Of Real Property Acquired By Eminent Domain.
453.description: To require redevelopment agencies acquiring real property by eminent domain to pay the landowner the value of the real property according to the most recent grand list when such value is higher than the average amount of the two independent appraisals.

454.title: An Act Concerning Penalties For And The Investigation Of The Operation Of Illegal Massage Establishments.
454.description: To add "shiatsu", "acupressure" and "Thai massage" to the list of services that may not be advertised without a license to engage in massage therapy; to provide that employers who employ unlicensed persons as massage therapists are guilty of a class C misdemeanor; and to require the Commissioner of Public Health and local health departments to investigate complaints that persons are engaging in the practice of massage therapy without a license within thirty days of receiving such complaint.

455.title: An Act Concerning Deficiency Judgments In Tax Lien Foreclosures.
455.description: To allow municipalities to seek deficiency judgments in a tax lien foreclosure.

456.title: An Act Concerning The Southeastern Council Of Governments And The Southeastern Connecticut Water Authority.
456.description: To replace the Representative Advisory Board to the Southeastern Water Authority with the Southeastern Connecticut Council of Governments, to give said Council additional supervisory powers and to make technical and conforming changes.

457.title: An Act Concerning Municipal Automated Traffic Enforcement Safety Devices At Certain Intersections.
457.description: To authorize municipalities to use automated traffic enforcement safety devices.

458.title: An Act Concerning Mass Transit Fares.
458.description: To require a study on the state's mass transit fares.

459.title: An Act Concerning Wreckers And Tow Trucks.
459.description: To allow for towing of divisible and nondivisible loads in conformance with federal regulations and in excess of axle gross combination vehicle weight or federal bridge formula requirements for nondivisible vehicles or loads.

460.last_action: Reported Out of Legislative Commissioners' Office
460.title: An Act Requiring The Department Of Social Services To Report Program Metrics Of The Department's Nonemergency Medical Transportation Program.
460.description: To require the Commissioner of Social Services to report the metrics of the department's Medicaid transportation program to the Transportation Committee.

461.title: An Act Concerning Deadlines For Program Participation And Reinstatement Of A Motor Vehicle Operator's License Under The Alcohol And Drug Addiction Treatment Program.
461.description: To provide law enforcement the ability to determine whether a motor vehicle operator operating without a license is a repeat offender.

462.title: An Act Concerning Requests For Records Under The Freedom Of Information Act And Appointments To The Freedom Of Information Commission.
462.description: To change the term of the legislatively appointed members of the Freedom of Information Commission from two years to four years, and to clarify that requests under the Freedom of Information Act may be oral rather than written.

463.title: An Act Prohibiting State Contracts With Entities Making Certain Investments In Iran.
463.description: To ensure that Connecticut is in compliance with the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012 and the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act of 2010 by prohibiting state agencies from contracting with entities who have invested twenty million dollars or more in the Iranian energy or financial sectors.

464.title: An Act Concerning Stream Channel Encroachment Lines And Permits.
464.description: To minimize any adverse affects of state regulations on business, to streamline and expedite the state permitting and regulatory processes, to prevent the inclusion of state agency administrative fees in certain economic development grants, and to repeal the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection's authority to establish stream channel encroachment lines and issue permits for encroachments upon or uses and activities within them.

465.title: An Act Concerning Social Enterprise Businesses.
465.description: To provide for the incorporation of social enterprise businesses in Connecticut.

466.title: An Act Creating A Workforce To Make Improvements Around Connecticut's Public Airports.
466.description: To facilitate home improvements for noise reduction and weatherization and energy efficiency for homeowners within certain areas around the state's public airports.

467.title: An Act Concerning Regional Technology Deployment Centers.
467.description: To promote certain technology deployment by linking representatives of businesses, constituent units of higher education and municipal governments within single geographic regions of the state.

468.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
468.title: An Act Concerning Equalizing Commercial Motor Vehicle Taxes.
468.description: To equalize the mill rate for commercial motor vehicles.

469.title: An Act Supporting Economic Development In An Urban Central Business District.
469.description: To allow certain municipalities to restrict state agency locations to the town or city's central business district.

470.title: An Act Concerning Refund Claim Periods For Sales And Use Taxes And Personal Income Tax.
470.description: To provide an opportunity for taxpayers to claim a refund for an overpayment of taxes by making the deadline for such claims either three years after the date of filing a return or two years after the date of paying the tax, whichever is later.

471.title: An Act Concerning Filing Deadlines For Certain Property Tax Exemptions.
471.description: To allow certain companies to apply for the property tax exemption for manufacturing machinery and equipment, notwithstanding the statutory deadline.

472.title: An Act Concerning Public Access Operations And The Periodic Review Of Video Providers.
472.description: To review any person, entity or company holding a certificate of public convenience and necessity to provide community antenna television service, a certificate of cable franchise authority or a certificate of video franchise authority, to ensure funding for certain programming, to clarify the procedure for changing public access providers and to reestablish the Broadband Internet Coordinating Council.

473.title: An Act Concerning The Autonomy Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.
473.description: To establish the autonomy of the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.

474.title: An Act Concerning Nursing Homes.
474.description: To require a study quality of care and access to services at nursing homes.

475.title: An Act Expanding Consumer Choice For Life Support Care At Home.
475.description: To expand consumer options for continuous, skilled nursing care at home.

476.title: An Act Concerning Medicaid.
476.description: To study quality of care and access to services under Medicaid-funded programs.

477.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Children And Families.
477.description: To require a study of programs administered by the Department of Children and Families.

478.title: An Act Concerning Accountability Of Insurers To Consumers.
478.description: To strengthen insurer accountability and enhance consumer protection.

479.title: An Act Concerning Increasing Home And Community-based Care For Elderly Medicaid Recipients.
479.description: To expand access to home and community-based care for elderly recipients of Medicaid.

481.title: An Act Expanding The Congregate Meals Program For The Elderly.
481.description: To offer congregate meals under the elderly nutrition program for at least one additional day.

482.title: An Act Concerning Coverage Of Telemedicine Services Under Medicaid.
482.description: To provide coverage for telemedicine health services under the state Medicaid plan.

483.title: An Act Concerning Credit Allowed A Domestic Ceding Insurer For Reinsurance.
483.description: To update the insurance statutes concerning credit for reinsurance.

484.title: An Act Concerning The Connecticut Health Insurance Exchange.
484.description: To make various changes to the duties of the Connecticut Health Insurance Exchange, to require the Insurance and Real Estate Committee to select the benchmark plan for purposes of establishing the standard for qualified health plans and plans sold outside the exchange and to require the General Assembly to approve such selection.

485.title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Coverage For Prescription Drugs And Breast Thermography.
485.description: To limit an insured's annual out-of-pocket expenses for prescription drugs and to require health insurance coverage for breast thermography.

486.title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Small Business Healthcare Working Group And Claims Information Required To Be Provided By Insurers.
486.description: To implement the recommendations of the small business healthcare working group, and to amend the claims information and the format of such information that insurers are required to provide annually to or upon request by certain employers.

487.title: An Act Concerning Risk Reduction Credits For Certain Criminal Offenses That Result In The Death Of Another Person.
487.description: To provide that an inmate is ineligible to earn risk reduction credits if imprisoned for the offense of manslaughter in the first degree, manslaughter in the first degree with a firearm, manslaughter in the second degree, manslaughter in the second degree with a firearm, or manslaughter in the second degree with a motor vehicle, in order to prohibit the award of risk reduction credits for offenses where the inmate caused the death of another person with intent to cause serious physical injury or death, recklessly or while operating a motor vehicle under the influence of intoxicating liquor or drug.

488.title: An Act Concerning The Abatement Of A Public Nuisance And Criminal Lockout.
488.description: To afford greater protections to municipalities and the state when abating public nuisances.

489.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of Benefit Corporations.
489.description: To provide for the establishment of benefit corporations in the state.

490.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
490.title: An Act Concerning Addendums To Contracts Between The State And Any Municipality In Which A Correctional Facility Is Located.
490.description: To permit a municipality in which a state-operated correctional facility is located to obtain an addendum to any contract that is in effect between the municipality and a state agency related to the correctional facility.

491.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
491.title: An Act Providing Municipal Stormwater Authorities With Certain Corporate Powers.
491.description: To provide that municipal stormwater authorities are corporate entities and to confer certain powers upon such authorities, and to allow such authorities to place a lien against real property for unpaid charges.

492.title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Payments During A Civil Preparedness Emergency.
492.description: To relieve property owners from having to pay property taxes if such taxes are due during a time when the Governor has declared a state of emergency.

493.title: An Act Concerning The Removal Of The Possessions Of Deceased Tenants.
493.description: To make certain changes regarding the manner in which a landlord may dispose of the possessions of a deceased tenant, and to allow a landlord to retain the proceeds of any disposal by sale or auction.

494.title: An Act Making Revisions To The Sachem's Head Association Charter.
494.description: To make certain revisions to The Sachem's Head Association charter concerning voting eligibility, executive board powers and duties, terms of office, requirements for posting notice of meetings and the adoption of by-laws, ordinances and amendments and to make technical changes.

495.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Legislative Program Review And Investigations Committee Requiring Committees Of Cognizance To Conduct Reviews Under The Sunset Law.
495.description: To require the committees of cognizance rather than the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee to conduct performance audits and report regarding their findings concerning entities or programs scheduled for termination under the sunset law.

496.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Legislative Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Regulation Of Hearing Instrument Specialists And Audiologists.
496.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee concerning modification of the continuing education requirements for audiologists and hearing instrument specialists.

497.title: An Act Concerning Changes To The Funeral Services Statutes.
497.description: To make changes to various statutes concerning funeral services.

498.title: An Act Concerning Regulations Relating To Hospice Care.
498.description: To require the Department of Public Health to adopt regulations concerning facilities offering hospice services.

499.title: An Act Concerning An Adjustment To Certain Dates Relating To The Financing Of Steel Point In Bridgeport.
499.description: To allow a municipality to include incremental state sales taxes and personal income taxes as part of the financing plan for a redevelopment project, and to adjust certain dates related to the financing for the Steel Point project in Bridgeport.

500.title: An Act Concerning Eyewitness Identification Procedures.
500.description: To adopt the legislative recommendations of the Eyewitness Identification Task Force.

501.title: An Act Concerning Standing To Appeal A Zoning Decision And Establishing Criminal Penalties For Violation Of Municipal Blight Ordinances.
501.description: To: (1) Limit appeals of certain zoning decisions to an aggrieved person who owns land in this state, and clarify that an "aggrieved person", in the case of a decision by a zoning commission, planning commission, combined planning and zoning commission or zoning board of appeals, includes a person who owns land that abuts or is within one hundred feet of the land involved in the decision, provided such person's land is within this state; and (2) grant municipalities general power to obtain a search warrant in order to enforce municipal ordinances, regulations and other administration or enforcement powers granted by statute.

502.title: An Act Concerning The Recording Of Telephonic Communications.
502.description: To amend provisions concerning the illegal recording of telephonic communications.

503.title: An Act Concerning Commercial Sexual Exploitation Of A Minor.
503.description: To establish a crime of commercial sexual exploitation of a minor under which a person may be guilty if such person knowingly publishes, disseminates or displays an advertisement for a commercial sex act which is to take place in this state and includes a depiction of a minor without first ascertaining the true age of the person depicted in the advertisement.

504.title: An Act Concerning Indecent Exposure To Persons Under The Age Of Sixteen.
504.description: To establish that public indecency committed knowing that such conduct will be viewed by a person under sixteen years of age shall constitute a class D felony, and require those convicted of the offense to register with the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection as a sexual offender in the manner provided for those convicted of a criminal offense against a victim who is a minor.
