505.title: An Act Concerning Good Samaritan Protections.
505.description: To (1) amend section 52-557b of the general statutes to properly reflect that the American Red Cross and the American Heart Association publish guidelines relating to cardiopulmonary resuscitation training, and (2) to extend good samaritan protections to certain individuals who provide assistance at temporary emergency shelters established after the Governor has declared a civil preparedness emergency.

506.last_action: Referred by House to Committee on Appropriations
506.title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of Enhanced Recognition Number Plates.
506.description: To: (1) Clarify that operation of a truck on a highway where truck passage is prohibited constitutes an infraction, and establish a defense for such operation if the operator has a permit for such use or presents evidence of a destination or origin related to such highway, and (2) provide for the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles to design and issue enhanced recognition number plates to replace existing number plates, other than special number plates, to enhance the ability of children and other individuals to assist in a law enforcement investigation of an abduction or other crime by better enabling the child or other individual to recall and describe the number plate of a suspect motor vehicle.

507.title: An Act Concerning Misrepresentation Of Town Of Residency With Respect To School Accommodations.
507.description: To make misrepresentation of residency with the intent to fraudulently obtain school accommodations from a school district a misdemeanor offense.

508.title: An Act Concerning The Payment Of Alimony And Child Support.
508.description: To (1) enact reforms concerning the amount and durational limits of alimony awards entered in family matters, and (2) provide family court judges with the authority to establish child support trust accounts.

509.title: An Act Providing Notice Of Pending Family Relations Matters To Judges In Family Violence Cases.
509.description: To provide a judge in a criminal family violence case with notice that the parties in the case are also parties in a pending family relations matter, including, but not limited to, a divorce or child custody matter or an application for a civil restraining order.

510.title: An Act Concerning The Budget, Special Assessment And Assignment Of Future Income Approval Process In Common Interest Ownership Communities.
510.description: To: (1) Require that the budget and a special assessment of a common interest community be approved by a majority of the unit owners voting instead of a majority of all unit owners, (2) reform the voting process used in a common interest community concerning approval of an assignment of a right to future income when used as security in a loan agreement.

511.title: An Act Concerning The Reporting Of A Missing Child.
511.description: To establish a penalty for a parent, guardian or person having custody or control, or providing supervision, of any child under the age of twelve years who knowingly fails to report the disappearance of the child.

512.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To Various Statutes Concerning The Criminal Justice System.
512.description: To: (1) Revise the procedure for the forfeiture of property seized as a result of a lawful arrest or search; (2) increase the penalties for certain "peeping tom" violations, including subsequent offenses and those involving children; (3) eliminate a notice requirement concerning DNA evidence; and (4) provide that probation officers may set bail in the course of serving arrest warrants for violation of probation.

513.title: An Act Concerning Various Revisions To The Public Health Statutes.
513.description: To make various changes to the public health statutes.

514.title: An Act Concerning Physician Assistants.
514.description: To describe the written protocols that a supervising physician shall provide to a physician assistant.

515.title: An Act Concerning Prescription Drug Administration In Nursing Home Facilities.
515.description: To allow nursing home facilities to make substitutions for drugs prescribed to patients with the approval of the prescribing physician.

516.title: An Act Concerning A Barbershop Apprenticeship Program.
516.description: To study the establishment of a barbershop apprenticeship program.

517.title: An Act Making Technical Revisions To The Statute Concerning Election Disclosure.

518.title: An Act Concerning The Conveyance Of Certain Parcels Of State Land.
518.description: To convey certain parcels of land owned by the state.

519.title: An Act Requiring The Electronic Submission Of Reports Regarding Government Efficiency By The Commission On Innovation And Productivity.
519.description: To require the Commission on Innovation and Productivity to submit its recommendations for government efficiency in electronic form rather than by mail and to make technical changes.

520.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of An Electronic Delivery Service Under The Connecticut Uniform Electronic Transactions Act And Defining Electronic Mail.
520.description: To permit any state, quasi-public or municipal agency to send communications using electronic or digital methods instead of by mail and to make a technical change.

521.title: An Act Making A Technical Change To A Statute Concerning The Office Of State Ethics.
521.description: To delete an obsolete reference to the State Ethics Commission.

522.title: An Act Eliminating A Conference On Ethical Issues.
522.description: To eliminate the conference on ethical issues affecting legislators and lobbyists held every two years.

523.title: An Act Making A Technical Revision To A Statute Concerning Construction And Public Works.

524.title: An Act Concerning Voyeurism.
524.description: To extend the crime of voyeurism to voyeurism committed pursuant to trespass, establish a heightened penalty for voyeurism when committed against a child under sixteen years of age, and require offenders to register as sexual offenders with the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection.

525.title: An Act Concerning The Membership Of The Emergency Medical Services Advisory Board And An Emergency Services Policy Council.
525.description: To change the member appointments in the emergency medical services advisory board and to require the Office of Emergency Medical Services, within the Department of Public Health, to study the establishment of an emergency services policy council.

526.title: An Act Concerning A Working Group To Study Health Care Reform.
526.description: To convene a working group to study and make recommendations concerning health care reform.

527.title: An Act Concerning Changes To The Public Financing Act And Other Election Laws.
527.description: To amend the campaign finance laws, including provisions concerning independent expenditures and attributions, contribution limits, disclosure and fundraising under the Citizens' Election Program.

528.title: An Act Concerning Public Employee's Pensions Solvency.
528.description: To establish a special purpose quasi-public entity to create a mechanism for funding the state's pension obligations by allowing such entity to use pension fund moneys to buy certain insurance premiums, the benefits of which shall return to the pension fund.

529.title: An Act Concerning A Study On The Waiver Of Fines And Penalties For Certain Business Regulation Violations.
529.description: To permit businesses to remediate regulatory violations without penalty if such violations are remediated in a timely manner.

530.title: An Act Concerning "public Declaration" By Candidates And Creating A Separate Petitioning Process For Minor Party And Petitioning Candidates To Receive A Grant Under The Citizens' Election Program.
530.description: To refine the election laws to provide for a definition of "public declaration" and for a dual process for ballot access and grant qualification under the Citizens' Election Program for minor party and petitioning candidates.

531.title: An Act Concerning The Cross-endorsement Of Candidates For Purposes Of Minority Representation.
531.description: To provide that for the purposes of minority representation a candidate who is cross-endorsed will be considered a member of the political party from which the candidate received the highest number of votes, based on which party line the votes are cast.

532.title: An Act Concerning Vacancies In Certain Town Offices And Minority Representation.
532.description: To clarify provisions concerning the filling of a vacancy for certain town offices and concerning minority representation on boards, commissions, committees or bodies.

533.title: An Act Concerning Robbery Committed At A Bank Or Credit Union.
533.description: To clarify the type of threat required for conviction of robbery on the premises or property of a bank, Connecticut bank or federal credit union.

534.title: An Act Concerning Continuation Of Health Insurance Coverage After A Divorce Or Legal Separation.
534.description: To provide continued health insurance coverage to parties to a divorce or legal separation.

535.title: An Act Concerning Certification As A Community Association Manager, Licensure As A Real Estate Broker Or Salesperson And The Display Of An Object Related To A Religious Practice Or Belief On The Door Or Door Frame Of A Condominium Unit.
535.description: To revise requirements concerning: (1) Certification as a community association manager; (2) continuing education for a licensed real estate broker or sales person; and (3) the organization of a unit owner's association.

536.title: An Act Establishing A Property Tax Program To Encourage The Preservation Of Historic Barns.
536.description: To authorize municipalities to enact a program that will provide property tax benefits to property owners who agree to preserve historic agricultural structures.

537.title: An Act Concerning Property Tax Exemptions For Solar And Other Renewable Energy Source Installations.
537.description: To make solar panels and similar installations on business and industrial property exempt from property tax.

538.title: An Act Concerning Recording Fees.
538.description: To make certain changes concerning the fees that town clerks may charge for copies of documents.

539.title: An Act Concerning The Disposal Of Solid Waste At Out-of-state Land Disposal Facilities.
539.description: To transfer certain powers from the Bristol Resource Recovery Facility Operating Committee to the West Central Connecticut Solid Waste and Recycling Board.

540.title: An Act Concerning Services Provided By Dental Professionals And Certification For Advanced Dental Hygiene Practitioners.
540.description: To describe services that may be performed by certain dental professionals and to increase access to and utilization of dental care for underserved populations through the use of advanced dental hygiene practitioners.

541.title: An Act Concerning Consumer Protection For Utility Customers.
541.description: To disclose the salaries of certain executives of public utility holding companies, to limit the ratepayer funds used to compensate such executives, to credit certain utility customers for food losses during prolonged service outages and to require certain utility companies to waive late fees and credit customers during prolonged service outages.

542.title: An Act Concerning The Creation And Expansion Of Municipal Electric Utilities.
542.description: To clarify the eminent domain power of a municipality concerning electric distribution facilities and the process for expanding a municipal electric utility's service area into a neighboring town.

543.title: An Act Concerning Storm Preparation And Emergency Response.
543.description: To review the emergency response and service restoration efforts of certain public service companies and to establish emergency response and service restoration performance standards for such companies; to require back-up generators for telecommunications towers; to encourage the placement of certain utility infrastructure underground; to enable increased tree trimming; and to establish a micro-grid grant and loan pilot program.

544.title: An Act Concerning Financial Liability For Ambulance Services, Evidence Of Collateral Source Payments And Evidence Of Bills From Treating Healthcare Providers.
544.description: To: (1) Specify that a person is liable in contract to pay for the cost of services delivered by an ambulance provider, (2) clarify the purposes for which certain health care provider bills may be used in personal injury and wrongful death actions, and (3) specify that the provisions of public act 11-205 apply to actions pending on or after July 1, 2011.

545.title: An Act Concerning Sentence Modification For Juveniles.
545.description: To require the Connecticut Sentencing Commission to examine and make recommendations regarding sentence modification for persons imprisoned for lengthy sentences based on offenses committed as juveniles.

546.title: An Act Concerning Release From Arrest Without Further Criminal Complaint.
546.description: To: (1) Provide that a peace officer who arrests a person without prior complaint or warrant and thereafter determines that there are insufficient grounds for a criminal complaint may release such person, and such person not deemed to be arrested, and (2) make a conforming change for intoxicated persons assisted by police officers.

547.title: An Act Concerning Domestic Violence.
547.description: To implement recommendations of the legislative task force on domestic violence.

548.title: An Act Concerning The Filing Of A Motion To Open A Judgment Of Foreclosure.
548.description: To prescribe the permissible time frame for the filing of a motion to open a judgment of foreclosure.

549.title: An Act Providing Federal Probation Officers With Access To Firearm Data Regarding Probationers.
549.description: To provide federal probation officers with access to the state firearm database to determine whether persons serving a period of federal probation possess a permit to carry a firearm.

550.title: An Act Concerning The Protection Of Power And Telephone Lines.
550.description: To (1) allow companies that provide electric or telephone services to acquire by eminent domain a tree or shrub that is on or adjacent to an existing right-of-way or easement held by the company if the company determines that such tree or shrub would cause an interruption in the delivery of such service due to the condition of the tree or in the event of a storm accompanied by winds of hurricane force, snow or ice, and (2) make technical changes.

551.title: An Act Concerning The Penalties For Failure To Report Child Abuse.
551.description: To strengthen the penalties associated with an individual's failure to report suspected child abuse or neglect.

552.title: An Act Concerning Substance Abuse Programs.
552.description: To: (1) Revise the penalty for a third conviction of operating a motor vehicle under the influence to allow reinstatement of an operator's license after two years with lifetime installation and maintenance of an approved ignition interlock device, (2) provide conformity for the victim impact panel program fees by amending one reference to such fee to reflect the amount of seventy-five dollars, and (3) permit persons who were eligible to participate in the Department of Motor Vehicles treatment and assessment program that was repealed effective January 1, 2012, to complete participation in such program and seek reinstatement of an operator's license or nonresident operating privilege in accordance with the requirements of the program that were in effect December 31, 2011, and establish a similar optional program for new offenders.

553.title: An Act Concerning Habeas Corpus Reform.

554.title: An Act Concerning Diversionary Programs.
554.description: To: (1) Revise the pretrial drug education program by redesignating the program as a pretrial drug education and community service program and revising eligibility and participation requirements for the program, (2) limit eligibility for the community service labor program to enumerated offenses after conviction, (3) revise the eligibility criteria for accelerated rehabilitation, (4) expand mediation programs in criminal prosecutions to all geographical area court locations, and (5) permit a court or prosecutor to consider the fact that a defendant has made a monetary contribution to a private nonprofit charity or other nonprofit organization, in a manner currently permitted for the consideration of community service work.

555.title: An Act Concerning Changes To Campaign Finance Laws And Other Election Laws.
555.description: An Act Concerning Changes To Campaign Finance Laws And Other Election Laws.

556.title: An Act Making Adjustments To State Expenditures For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2013.
556.description: An Act Making Adjustments To State Expenditures For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2013.

557.title: An Act Concerning Jobs And The Economy.
557.description: To expand certain state programs to continue to grow Connecticut jobs.

558.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
558.title: An Act Eliminating Longevity Payments And Eliminating Overtime Compensation From The Calculation Of Pensions For State Employees.
558.description: To establish more accountability in public employee compensation.

559.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology
559.title: An Act Concerning A Sales Tax Exemption For Biofuel Companies.
559.description: To extend the sales tax exemption to biofuel companies for the purchase of machinery, equipment, tools, supplies or fuel.

560.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
560.title: An Act Concerning An Exemption From Personal Income Tax For Social Security Payments.
560.description: To exempt Social Security payments from taxation under the state income tax.

561.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
561.title: An Act Concerning A Cap On The Petroleum Gross Earnings Tax.
561.description: To prevent the state from receiving a windfall in tax revenue when gas prices rise, to reduce taxes and to slow the increase in gas prices.

562.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
562.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Bond Proceeds.
562.description: To require that bond proceeds be used only for their intended purpose and prohibit the use of bond proceeds to pay for ongoing general government expenditures.

563.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
563.title: An Act Concerning The Treatment Of Deferred Income Under The Connecticut Alternative Minimum Tax.
563.description: To avoid the double taxation of certain deferred income under the Connecticut alternative minimum tax.

564.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
564.title: An Act Repealing The Estate Tax.
564.description: To eliminate the estate tax in order to attract and retain more families and small businesses capable of providing a revenue stream to the state over a longer duration.

565.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
565.title: An Act Concerning The Corporation Business Tax Rate.
565.description: To stimulate the economy, help grow jobs and attract businesses to the state.

566.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
566.title: An Act Concerning The Personal Income Tax Rate.
566.description: To retain and attract more people and businesses capable of funding the necessary revenue for the state.

567.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
567.title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Medical Assistance To Noncitizens.
567.description: To increase the level of funding provided to the state's medical assistance to noncitizens program.

568.title: An Act Concerning Guidelines For Health Insurance Coverage For Colorectal Cancer Screening.
568.description: To clarify the criteria for insurance coverage of breast magnetic resonance imaging.

569.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of Telemedicine Services.
569.description: To require health insurance coverage of medical advice, diagnosis, care or treatment provided through telemedicine if such advice, diagnosis, care or treatment is covered when provided through in-person consultation.

570.title: An Act Concerning Health Information Technology Week.
570.description: To designate the second week in September of each year as Health Information Technology Week.

571.title: An Act Concerning The Residential Property Condition Disclosure Report.
571.description: To require disclosure in the residential property condition disclosure report of any remediation of hazardous waste to which the property is subject or has been subjected.

572.title: An Act Exempting New Home Builders' Employees From Real Estate Licensing Requirements.
572.description: To exempt an employee of a new home construction contractor from being required to be licensed as a real estate broker or real estate salesperson.

573.title: An Act Concerning Mileage-based Automobile Insurance Policies.
573.description: To establish standards for private passenger nonfleet automobile insurance policies that use verified actual mileage as a factor in underwriting or rating.

574.title: An Act Extending The Permissible Age Limit For Health Insurance Coverage Of Infertility Treatment.
574.description: To extend the permissible age limit for health insurance coverage of infertility treatment from forty to forty-five years of age.

575.title: An Act Concerning Health Insurance Coverage For The Treatment Of Head Lice.
575.description: To require health insurance plans that cover prescription drugs to cover prescription drugs for the treatment of head lice.

576.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of The Assessment Methodology Used By The Insurance Department And The Office Of The Healthcare Advocate.
576.description: To expand the base of insurers assessed for the expenditures of the Insurance Department and the Office of the Healthcare Advocate.

577.title: An Act Defining The Expenditure Cap.
577.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

578.title: An Act Concerning The Capital Region Development Authority.
578.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

579.title: An Act Enhancing Emergency Preparedness And Response.
579.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

580.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
580.title: An Act Concerning Educational Competitiveness.
580.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

581.title: An Act Authorizing And Adjusting Bonds Of The State For Capital Improvements, Transportation And Other Purposes.
581.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

582.title: An Act Concerning Deadlines For Consensus Revenue Estimates.
582.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

583.title: An Act Transitioning The Regulations Of Connecticut State Agencies To An Online Format.
583.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

584.title: An Act Implementing The Governor's Recommendation Concerning An Annual Report On Higher Education.
584.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

585.title: An Act Concerning The Connecticut Health And Educational Facilities Authority.
585.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

586.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
586.title: An Act Implementing Provisions Of The Budget Concerning Human Services.
586.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

587.title: An Act Establishing A Commission On Judicial Compensation.
587.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

588.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
588.title: An Act Concerning State Police Staffing.
588.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

589.title: An Act Concerning Department Of Transportation Project Delivery And Project Labor Agreements For Certain Public Works Projects.
589.description: To implement the Governor's budget recommendations.

590.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
590.title: An Act Allowing Certain Members Of The Teachers' Retirement System To Purchase Credited Service.
590.description: To allow full-time teachers to purchase credit for time spent as a part-time lecturer at a community college.

591.title: An Act Concerning The Office Of State Ethics And Revisions To The State Codes Of Ethics.
591.description: To redefine lobbyist registration and reporting requirements by those who lobby within the scope of employment, to require prospective members of the Citizen's Ethics Advisory Board to certify that they are aware of the special restrictions of the code of ethics that would apply to them, to prohibit public officials from taking certain actions that would benefit their outside employers, to subject board members of the State Health Insurance Exchange to the Code of Ethics, to redefine "gift" for purposes of the codes of ethics and to make other revisions to the codes of ethics.

592.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The State Codes Of Ethics.
592.description: To permit the Office of State Ethics to recover the amount of any financial benefit received by a state contractor for certain violations, to add a violation of section 1-101nn of the general statutes to the list of violations that are grounds for disqualifying a state contractor, to prohibit the staff and members of the Citizen's Ethics Advisory Board and the Office of State Ethics from participating in political campaigns, to give the Office of State Ethics the authority to interpret Parts III and IV of chapter 10 of the general statutes, to give the Office of State Ethics the ability to enforce the revolving door restrictions applying to former Gaming Policy Board members and directors of the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority, to increase the threshold for lobbyist registration to $3,000, to add other agencies to the definition of quasi-public agencies, to change certain reporting dates, to exempt the Office of State Ethics from certain fee requirements, and to make other changes to the codes of ethics.

593.title: An Act Concerning Cost Saving Measures And Notice Of Legislative Sessions.
593.description: To permit the Secretary of the State to notify legislators of special or reconvened sessions by means other than by first class mail.

594.title: An Act Concerning The Publishing Of Executive Orders Proclaiming An Emergency By The Secretary Of The State.
594.description: To permit the Secretary of the State to post executive orders concerning the Governor's proclamation of certain emergencies on the secretary's Internet web site and publish such orders in the Connecticut Law Journal rather than publish them in a newspaper.

595.title: An Act Concerning Requirements For Early Childhood Educators.
595.description: To clarify the staff qualification requirements for early childhood education programs serving infants, toddlers or preschool age children and accepting state funds for such programs' child day care or school readiness programs.

596.title: An Act Concerning College Readiness And Completion.
596.description: To allow all students open access to entry level courses in a college level program and prohibit public institutions of higher education from forcing any student to enroll in a remedial course.

597.title: An Act Concerning Workforce Development.
597.description: To study issues concerning workforce development.

598.title: An Act Concerning The Selection Process For Members Of The Faculty Advisory Committee To The Board Of Regents For Higher Education.
598.description: To ensure that the selection process for members of the faculty advisory committee to the Board of Regents for Higher Education is a uniform process.

599.title: An Act Requiring The Submission Of Information Concerning Students Receiving Financial Assistance From The Connecticut Independent Student Grant Program, Connecticut Aid To Public College Students Grant Program And Capitol Scholarship Grant Program.
599.description: To require a study of issues concerning higher education.

600.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
600.title: An Act Concerning Appropriations For Community And Home-based Care.
600.description: To expand "aging in place" by providing greater assistance to seniors to remain in their homes as they age.

601.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
601.title: An Act Concerning Appropriations For The Non-ada Dial-a-ride Program.
601.description: To ensure the availability of adequate transportation for seniors.

602.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
602.title: An Act Concerning Incentives For State Defense Contractors To Buy From In-state Contractors And Businesses.
602.description: To create incentives for defense contractors to use in-state subcontractors when possible.

603.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
603.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Budget Surpluses.
603.description: To utilize half of all state budget surpluses for income tax relief by increasing the amount of income that is exempt from income taxation.

604.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
604.title: An Act Concerning An Exemption From Income Tax For All Social Security Income.
604.description: To exempt Social Security income from state income tax.

605.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
605.title: An Act Privatizing The Administration Of The State's Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program.
605.description: To privatize the administration of the state's supplemental nutrition assistance program.

606.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
606.title: An Act Appropriating Funds To The Department Of Social Services For An Updated Computer System.
606.description: To provide the computer resources necessary for the state to meet federal health care reform requirements for the administration of state public assistance.

607.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Health
607.title: An Act Concerning An Increased Appropriation To The Department Of Public Health For Breast Cancer Research And Education.
607.description: To increase the funding available for breast cancer research, education and prevention.

608.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
608.title: An Act Concerning State Employee Pension Reform.
608.description: To save the state money and reduce the state's long-term liabilities by enacting comprehensive pension reform.

609.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
609.title: An Act Concerning The Effective Date Of Tax Increases.
609.description: To prohibit the retroactive application of new or increased taxes.

610.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Indoor Tanning Devices By Persons Under Eighteen Years Of Age.
610.description: To prohibit the use of indoor tanning devices by persons under age eighteen.

611.title: An Act Expanding The Membership Of The Pharmaceutical And Therapeutics Committee.
611.description: To expand the membership of the Pharmaceutical and Therapeutics Committee to include a child psychiatrist.

612.title: An Act Concerning Critical Congenital Heart Disease Screening For Newborn Infants.
612.description: To require pulse oximetry screening tests for newborn infants.

613.title: An Act Concerning The Licensure Of Food Manufacturing Establishments.
613.description: To require the licensure and oversight of food manufacturing establishments.

614.title: An Act Concerning Bowling Establishment Alcoholic Liquor Permit Fees.
614.description: To reduce the annual bowling establishment alcoholic liquor permit fee.

615.title: An Act Concerning Retail Wine Sellers And Wine-related Classes.
615.description: To allow fee-based wine education and tasting classes to be conducted on package store premises.

616.title: An Act Prohibiting Price Gouging During Severe Weather Events.
616.description: To protect consumers from price gouging during severe weather market disruptions.

617.title: An Act Exempting Amateur Radio Operators Using Hand-held Radios From The Prohibition On Using Hand-held Mobile Telephones And Mobile Electronic Devices While Driving.
617.description: To exempt HAM radio operators using hand-held radios from the prohibition on using mobile telephones or mobile electronic devices while operating a motor vehicle.

618.title: An Act Concerning The Connecticut Public Safety Data Network.
618.description: To provide for the governance of the Connecticut Public Safety Data Network.

619.title: An Act Concerning The Timing Of Tests For Blood Alcohol Levels In Operating Under The Influence Cases.
619.description: To require that in a criminal prosecution for drunken driving any test for blood alcohol levels not commenced within two hours be established as reliable by expert witness testimony and delete the requirement in an administrative per se hearing that a test for blood alcohol levels be commenced within two hours of operation.

620.title: An Act Concerning Regulation Of Firearms.
620.description: To make revisions concerning the offenses of carrying a firearm and hunting while under the influence, the information required on a receipt for the delivery of a firearm, the fees for and issuance of a handgun eligibility certificate and the officials required to be notified of a gun show.

621.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
621.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Banking.
621.description: To make changes to the general statutes relating to the Department of Banking.

622.title: An Act Concerning Economic Development.
622.description: To establish a task force to study ways in which the state may (1) encourage the growth of business, (2) stimulate job growth and increase state and municipal tax revenue, and (3) address concerns regarding the availability of financing after the merger, takeover or liquidation of a financial institution.

623.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Banking Statutes.
623.description: To make technical corrections to the banking statutes.

624.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
624.title: An Act Redirecting Authorized Bonds Of The State From The Busway To Repairing The State's Roads And Bridges.
624.description: To use the Hartford to New Britain busway bond funds for repairs to existing state roads and bridges.

625.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Energy and Technology
625.title: An Act Concerning Energy Assistance Programs For Low-income Residents.
625.description: To provide greater assistance to low-income residents to meet rising energy costs.

626.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
626.title: An Act Concerning Fairness In Certain Commercial Construction Contracts.
626.description: To require timely payment pursuant to certain commercial construction contracts.

627.title: An Act Expanding The "one Free Item" Retail Sales Law.
627.description: To require retailers to give consumers certain consumer commodities, such as vegetables or fruit, for free if the price of the commodity at the cash register is higher than the posted or advertised price.

628.title: An Act Allowing A Manufacturer Permit For Beer Permittee To Sell And Serve Food.
628.description: To authorize a manufacturer permit for beer permittee to serve and sell food on the permit premises and to allow such permittee to also hold a restaurant permit.

630.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
630.title: An Act Concerning Increased Home And Community-based Care Under Medicaid.
630.description: To save the state money and improve the quality of life of senior citizens by increasing participation in home and community-based care under the Medicaid program.

631.title: An Act Concerning A "connecticut-made" Marketing Campaign.
631.description: To establish a Connecticut-made program to promote products manufactured or produced in the state.

632.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Education
632.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of The Connecticut Treasures Program.
632.description: To establish a "Connecticut Treasures" program and require the Department of Education to develop a model curriculum on locations designated as "Connecticut Treasures".

633.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
633.title: An Act Concerning An Unemployed Armed Forces Member Subsidized Training And Employment Program.
633.description: To provide a subsidized training and employment program for certain members of the armed forces.

634.title: An Act Concerning The Learn Here, Live Here Program.
634.description: To allow graduates from certain higher education institutions to participate in the Learn Here, Live Here program and require payments from the Department of Economic and Community Development in accordance with the program.

635.title: An Act Concerning Unemployed Individuals And Discriminatory Hiring Practices.
635.description: To prevent discrimination of unemployed individuals in employment advertisements and in hiring for employment positions.

636.title: An Act Expanding Test Bed Authority At The Constituent Units Of The State System Of Higher Education.
636.description: To allow chief executive officers of constituent units of the state system of higher education to make purchases of certain technology, products or processes for trial testing at the constituent unit.

637.title: An Act Concerning Loan Repayment Terms And The Maximum Number Of Employees To Qualify For Certain Economic Development Programs.
637.description: To allow certain businesses with up to one hundred employees to participate in the Small Business Express and Subsidized Training and Employment programs, lengthen the term for repayment of loans from the Small Business Express program and modify and make appropriations to other programs.

638.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
638.title: An Act Concerning A Minimum Per Pupil Grant Amount To Towns Under Ecs.
638.description: To require the state to provide a minimum payment of one thousand dollars per pupil to each town under ECS.

639.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
639.title: An Act Authorizing Bow And Arrow Hunting On Sunday Under Certain Circumstances.
639.description: To allow hunting by bow and arrow on Sundays under certain circumstances in order to help control the state's deer population.

640.title: An Act Concerning Outdoor Wood-burning Furnaces.
640.description: To prohibit the use of wood-burning furnaces between May first and September thirtieth.

641.title: An Act Concerning Campground Reservations At Certain State Parks.
641.description: To amend an existing twenty-one-day aggregate limit on camping stays to apply only to the period between Memorial Day and Labor Day and to authorize the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to adopt regulations on this issue.

642.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
642.title: An Act Concerning The Structures And Dredging Permit Process.
642.description: To allow an applicant for a permit for dredging or erection of structures to request a public hearing on such application and to permit such applicant to appeal a final decision of the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection.

643.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
643.title: An Act Concerning Water Quality Certification Applications.
643.description: To permit any person who submits an application to the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection for a water quality certification to request a hearing on such application, and to authorize an applicant to appeal a decision on such hearing in accordance with the Uniform Administrative Procedure Act.

644.title: An Act Concerning The Public's Right To Know Of A Sewage Spill.
644.description: To establish a process for informing the public about sewage spills that can have public health and environmental implications.

645.title: An Act Establishing A Mattress Stewardship Program.
645.description: To establish a mattress stewardship program that will provide for post-consumer collection and recycling of mattresses throughout the state.

646.title: An Act Establishing A Loan Program For The Removal Of Hazardous Trees From Private Property.
646.description: To require insurers that deliver or issue for delivery in this state a homeowners insurance policy or a commercial general liability insurance policy to establish a program to provide loans to policyholders for proactive tree removal on residential or commercial property, and to require town tree wardens, borough tree wardens, city foresters or city officers with similar duties to inspect trees on residential or commercial property that pose a present or potential hazard.

647.title: An Act Concerning Enhanced Harbor Management Responsibilities.
647.description: To improve harbor management initiatives under the Connecticut Coastal Management Act.

648.title: An Act Concerning The Disposal And Collection Of Unused Medication.
648.description: To prohibit healthcare institutions from disposing medications into waste water systems and to establish a program for the collection and disposal of unused pharmaceuticals.

649.title: An Act Concerning A Mercury Thermostat Collection And Financial Incentive Program.
649.description: To establish a comprehensive collection system that provides a financial incentive for the return of thermostats that contain mercury in order to reduce the environmental and public health concerns posed by such thermostats.

650.title: An Act Concerning The Equal Treatment Of Renters With Mental Disabilities.
650.description: To clarify certain protections under state housing law for persons with disabilities.

652.last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
652.title: An Act Exempting Municipalities From The Health Insurance Premium Tax.
652.description: To exempt health insurance premiums paid by a municipality from the insurance premiums tax.

653.title: An Act Concerning Guidelines For Health Insurance Coverage For Breast Magnetic Resonance Imaging.
653.description: To prohibit insurers from imposing a coinsurance, copayment, deductible or other out-of-pocket expense on an insured for breast ultrasound screening, and to clarify the criteria for insurance coverage of breast magnetic resonance imaging.

654.title: An Act Concerning Deductibles For Screening Colonoscopies And Screening Sigmoidoscopies.
654.description: To prohibit insurers from imposing a deductible for a procedure that is initially undertaken as a screening colonoscopy or a screening sigmoidoscopy.

655.title: An Act Concerning Letters Of Protection.
655.description: To (1) require physicians and physical therapists to inform a patient whether they would provide care and treatment to such patient in return for a letter of protection guaranteeing payment from any settlement or judgment that may be received by the patient; and (2) require physicians and physical therapists to provide a patient with the estimated cost of obtaining an opinion letter that may be used by such patient in a personal injury action.

656.title: An Act Concerning The Recommendations Of The Sentencing Commission With Respect To Sexual Assault In The Fourth Degree And Kidnapping In The First Degree With A Firearm.
656.description: To: (1) Delete the word "intentionally" regarding sexual assault in the fourth degree for consistency with the remainder of the section; and (2) resolve an irreconcilable conflict in the mandatory minimum sentences prescribed for kidnapping in the first degree and kidnapping in the first degree with a firearm.

657.title: An Act Concerning Uninsured Motorist Coverage For Bodily Injury To A Named Insured Or Relative During The Theft Of A Motor Vehicle.
657.description: To provide uninsured motorist coverage to a named insured or a household member of the named insured for damages arising from being struck as a pedestrian during the theft of an insured vehicle.

658.title: An Act Prohibiting Local Building Standards.
658.description: To ensure state-wide consistency in construction standards by prohibiting municipalities from enforcing local building codes or construction standards other than those found in the State Building Code.

659.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Education
659.title: An Act Concerning The Consolidation Of Noneducational Services.
659.description: To encourage municipalities and boards of education to consider ways in which to realize financial efficiencies and to promote transparency in school budgets.

660.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
660.title: An Act Permitting Municipal Employees To Serve As Citation Hearing Officers.
660.description: To permit certain municipal employees to serve as citation hearing officers.

661.title: An Act Concerning The Rental Rebate Application Period.
661.description: To give municipalities more time to receive and process rental rebate applications.

662.title: An Act Concerning Employment Of Private Detectives By Municipalities.
662.description: To update and clarify existing law regarding municipal employment of private detectives.

663.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Environment
663.title: An Act Concerning The Time In Which A Regulated Activity Must Be Conducted Under A Permit Issued By An Inland Wetlands Commission.
663.description: To provide more time in which to conduct a regulated activity after obtaining a permit from an inland wetlands agency.

664.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Education
664.title: An Act Concerning The Creation Of An Educator Professional Standards Board Task Force.
664.description: To establish a task force to make recommendations for the creation of an educator professional standards board.

665.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Public Safety and Security
665.title: An Act Increasing The Maximum Surcharge For Enhanced 9-1-1 Service.
665.description: To provide adequate funds to support the state's emergency 9-1-1 system and overhaul the outdated core system so that it will accept digital communications.

666.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
666.title: An Act Requiring The Operation Of Gateway Tolls.
666.description: To require the immediate operation of gateway tolls.

667.title: An Act Concerning The Penalty For Causing Harm To A Vulnerable User Of A Public Way.
667.description: To provide a penalty for any person who causes harm to a vulnerable user of a public way.

668.title: An Act Concerning The Southeastern Connecticut Council Of Governments' Oversight Of The Southeast Area Transit District.
668.description: To provide the Southeastern Connecticut Council of Governments with oversight over the Southeast Area Transit District.

669.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
669.title: An Act Concerning Servicemembers Civil Relief Act Proceedings.
669.description: To provide that a member of the armed forces who is entitled to a stay in a civil action or proceeding pursuant to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act may seek relief and provide testimony by electronic means under certain conditions.

670.title: An Act Concerning Services For Veterans In Pretrial Diversionary Programs.
670.description: To provide for the development of treatment plans, conditions or programs in certain pretrial diversionary programs that are specifically for veterans.

671.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
671.title: An Act Concerning The Military Sexual Assault Prevention And Response Program.
671.description: To provide confidentiality for disclosures made by military personnel who are victims of sexual assault to military sexual assault advocates.

672.title: An Act Concerning A State Military Account For Morale, Welfare And Recreation Programs.
672.description: To establish accounts in the General Fund for the purposes of (1) billeting members of the armed forces, (2) operating military morale, welfare and recreation programs, (3) supporting the activities of the Governor's Guards, and (4) offsetting the cost of maintaining Governor's Guards' horses.

673.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
673.title: An Act Freezing State Spending.
673.description: To maintain state appropriations for the next two fiscal years at the 2010 level.

674.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
674.title: An Act Increasing Health Insurance Copayments For State Employees And State Elected Officials.
674.description: To increase the copayments for health insurance coverage for state employees and state elected officials. .

675.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
675.title: An Act Reducing Salaries Of State Employees And Elected Officials.
675.description: To cut the salaries of state employees and elected officials by ten per cent for the next two years.

676.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
676.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Start-up Connecticut Program.
676.description: To authorize bonds to provide state assistance to start-up businesses that have obtained patents for products for which there is demonstrated demand.

677.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
677.title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Development Services To Regional Economic Development Districts And The Authority To Pursue Economic Development Strategies.
677.description: To require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to fund and provide economic development services to regional economic development districts and give such districts the authority to contract and receive grants to accomplish the goals of a comprehensive economic development strategy.

678.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
678.title: An Act Concerning Various Bond Authorizations.
678.description: To authorize bond funds to construct a community center and recreational facility in New London.

679.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Eugene O'neill Theater Center.
679.description: To provide funds to the Eugene O'Neill Theater Center in Waterford for expansion of its physical campus.

680.title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of Students Enrolled In State Charter Schools In The Ecs Formula And The Per Pupil Grant For Students In State Charter Schools.
680.description: To reform the ECS funding system as it applies to charter schools.

681.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
681.title: An Act Concerning The Increase In Funding For Regional Agricultural Science And Technology Education Centers.
681.description: To increase funding for regional agricultural science and technology education centers and to provide more equitable funding for school choice programs.

682.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
682.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Repairs To Common Ground High School.
682.description: To authorize bonds of the state for repairs to Common Ground High School.

683.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
683.title: An Act Concerning A Public Secondary School Dropout Prevention Demonstration Grant Program.
683.description: To fund effective ways to prevent dropouts and to encourage schools to think about and adopt methods to do so.

684.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
684.title: An Act Concerning The Luxury Tax.

685.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
685.title: An Act Concerning The Business Entity Tax.
685.description: To exempt certain small businesses from the business entity tax.

686.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
686.title: An Act Repealing The State Portion Of The Real Estate Conveyance Tax.
686.description: To repeal the state portion of the real estate conveyance tax.

687.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
687.title: An Act Concerning The Repeal Of The Corporation Business Tax Surcharge.
687.description: To repeal the corporate tax surcharge.

688.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
688.title: An Act Repealing The Earned Income Tax Credit.
688.description: To repeal the earned income tax credit program.

690.last_action: Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
690.title: An Act Appropriating Funds To The Office Of Governmental Accountability To Fund The Hiring Of Campaign Finance Auditors By The State Elections Enforcement Commission.
690.description: To restore funding to the State Elections Enforcement Commission to ensure that it has sufficient resources to enforce our campaign finance laws.

691.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
691.title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Health Care To The State's Prison Population.
691.description: To reduce the medical costs incurred in treating the state's prison population.

692.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
692.title: An Act Limiting The Use Of The Special Transportation Fund.
692.description: To limit the use of the special transportation fund for only transportation projects.

693.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
693.title: An Act Concerning Fear Of Retaliation Training In Nursing Home Facilities.
693.description: To ensure that nursing home staff understand fear of retaliation and have resources available to prevent retaliation against residents.

694.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study "aging In Place".
694.description: To establish a task force to examine how the state can encourage aging in place.

695.title: An Act Concerning Notification Of Financial Stability Of Nursing Home Facilities And Managed Residential Communities To Patients And Residents.
695.description: To provide consumers with full disclosure of the current financial status of the nursing home facility or managed residential community so that consumers can make an informed decision about admission.

696.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Public Health
696.title: An Act Concerning Grievance Committees In Nursing Home Facilities.
696.description: To require nursing home facilities to have grievance committees consisting of, among others, one resident of the facility.

697.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Education
697.title: An Act Concerning Senior Safety Zones.
697.description: To prohibit sex offenders from entering senior centers or elderly housing.

698.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
698.title: An Act Increasing Eligibility For The Connecticut Home-care Program For The Elderly.
698.description: To increase the asset limits for the state-funded home-care program for the elderly.

699.title: An Act Increasing Eligibility For The Alzheimer Respite Care Program.
699.description: To increase the income limit for participation in the Alzheimer's Respite Care program.

700.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
700.title: An Act Expanding The State's Tax Incremental Financing Programs.
700.description: To expand tax incremental financing to include blended financing from property tax, sales tax and income tax.

701.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
701.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For The Construction Of A Senior Center In The Town Of Ellington.
701.description: To authorize bonds of the state to assist the growing senior population in the town of Ellington to meet its health, social and cultural needs.

702.title: An Act Concerning Foster Children In Higher Education.
702.description: To give priority to current or former foster children in class registration at public institutions of higher education and internship positions at state agencies.

703.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Transportation
703.title: An Act Providing Funding For Senior Transportation Programs.
703.description: To provide increased funding for senior transportation.

704.title: An Act Concerning A Study On The Labor Department's Waiver Of Weekly Pay Requirement.
704.description: To require the Labor Department to study the effects of requiring employers to pay employees in full at least twice each calendar month.

705.title: An Act Concerning The Denial Of Unemployment Compensation Benefits To Certain Drivers Who Are Unemployed As A Result Of A Drug Or Alcohol Test.

706.title: An Act Concerning Family And Medical Leave Benefits For Certain Municipal Employees.
706.description: To grant certain ineligible municipal paraprofessionals the right to family and medical leave.

707.title: An Act Concerning Additional Requirements For An Employer's Notice To Dispute Certain Care Deemed Reasonable For An Employee Under The Workers' Compensation Act.
707.description: To prevent an employer or employer's insurer from discontinuing, reducing or denying employee's course of treatment under the Workers' Compensation Act unless the employer provides notice and an opinion from another physician that such treatment is not reasonable, necessary, does not meet the appropriate standard of care.

708.title: An Act Concerning One Day Equals One Absence.
708.description: To allow employers to count each day of an employee's absence without good cause or notice to the employer count as a separate instance of absence for the purposes of eligibility for unemployment compensation benefits.

709.title: An Act Concerning A Retired State Employee Workforce Reserve.
709.description: To require the Commissioner of Administrative Services to develop a plan to utilize retired state employees on a part-time basis rather than allow state employees to accumulate overtime.

710.title: An Act Concerning State Employees And Violence And Abusive Conduct In The Workplace.
710.description: To require the Department of Administrative Services to report the number of complaints of abusive conduct in the workplace between state employees to the General Assembly.

711.title: An Act Allowing Employers To Pay Wages Using Payroll Cards.
711.description: To allow employers to pay employee wages using payroll cards.

712.title: An Act Concerning Sibling Visitation For Children In The Care And Custody Of The Commissioner Of Children And Families.
712.description: To ensure children and youth in the care and custody of the Commissioner of Children and Families visit with their sibling on a minimum basis in order to sustain the bond between siblings.

713.title: An Act Revising The Definition Of A Child Care Facility To Conform With The Definition Of A Child.
713.description: To revise the definition of a child care facility to conform with the definition of a child and permit any person not more than twenty-one years of age who is in school or a job training program to be placed in a child care facility without requiring that person to have been placed in a congregate residential setting prior to his eighteenth birthday.

714.title: An Act Concerning Enforcement By The Banking Commissioner.
714.description: To aid in the administration and enforceability of the Department of Banking's laws concerning consumer credit practices and its ability to protect the public by making certain aspects of the Banking Commissioner's authority concerning consumer credit practices similar to the commissioner's authority concerning persons engaged in the securities business, including providing the commissioner with administrative authority to order restitution and disgorgement on behalf of harmed Connecticut consumers.

715.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of The Elimination Of The Provision That Permits Foreclosure By A Holder Of A Note Who Does Not Have Legal Title To The Mortgaged Premises.
715.description: To repeal the provision that permits the mortgage to follow the note regardless of whether the holder of the note has legal title.

716.title: An Act Concerning The S.a.f.e. Mortgage Licensing Act.
716.description: To implement certain rule comments and clarifications emerging from the Department of Housing and Urban Development's final rule issued on June 30, 2011, entitled "SAFE Mortgage Licensing Act: Minimum Licensing Standards and Oversight Responsibilities", 76 Federal Register 38464, and to make various corresponding and technical changes.

717.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
717.title: An Act Concerning The Constitutional Spending Cap.
717.description: To implement the constitutional limitation on expenditures by the General Assembly and to prevent any spending in excess of the cap from inflating the cap in future years.

718.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
718.title: An Act Excluding Overtime Pay From The Calculation Of State Employee Pension Benefits.
718.description: To end the practice of pension padding and provide that overtime pay cannot be used to increase pension benefits for state employees.

719.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Appropriations
719.title: An Act Prohibiting Longevity Payments To State Employees.
719.description: To stop the practice of paying longevity bonuses to state employees.

720.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Commerce
720.title: An Act Concerning A Small Business Reinvestment Account.
720.description: To assist small businesses by allowing them to defer taxes on income that is set aside and used for capital expenses and worker training.

721.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Education
721.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For Development Of A Stem Curriculum In Middle Schools.
721.description: To provide funds in the amount of five million dollars for the development of a science, technology, engineering and mathematics curriculum in middles schools.

722.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
722.title: An Act Concerning An Exemption From The Sales Tax For Massage Therapy Performed By A Reflexologist.
722.description: To exempt from sales taxation massage therapy performed by a reflexologist, similar to the exemption for such services performed by massage therapists.

725.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
725.title: An Act Increasing The Tax Credits Available For Apprenticeship Training In Manufacturing, Construction And Plastics-related Trades.
725.description: To encourage businesses to hire and train apprentices by doubling the existing tax credits.

726.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
726.title: An Act Establishing A Tax Credit For The Donation Of Equipment To A Vocational Technical High School.
726.description: To encourage the donation of equipment to our vo-tech schools by allowing businesses to receive a tax credit for such donations.

727.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
727.title: An Act Expanding Angel Investor Credits.
727.description: To provide incentives for private investment in Connecticut businesses by allowing investments in any Connecticut business to qualify for an angel investor tax credit.

729.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Human Services
729.title: An Act Concerning The Dispensing Fee For Independent Pharmacies.
729.description: To help small independent pharmacies by doubling the dispensing fee paid for each prescription filled.

730.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Planning and Development
730.title: An Act Returning A Portion Of Monies Received By The State For The Sale Of Dog Licenses To Municipalities.
730.description: To encourage municipalities to complete surveys of unlicensed dogs.

731.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
731.title: An Act Exempting Cosmetic Grade Mineral Oil From The Petroleum Products Gross Earnings Tax .
731.description: To clarify the application of the gross earnings tax to cosmetic grade mineral oil.

732.title: An Act Concerning Nursing Home Compliance With Comfortable And Safe Temperature Standards.
732.description: To require nursing homes to have air conditioning in each resident's room by July 1, 2013.

733.title: An Act Concerning Notification To Potential And Existing Nursing Home Owners.
733.description: To put nursing home licensees and owners on notice that they may be held criminally liable for abuse or neglect perpetrated by nursing home employees against residents.

734.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
734.title: An Act Concerning Income Tax Deductions For Long-term Care Insurance Premiums.
734.description: To provide a personal income tax deduction for long-term care insurance premiums.

735.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
735.title: An Act Concerning Contractors, Subcontractors And Civil Actions To Recover Unpaid Employee Wages And Benefits.
735.description: To clarify that subcontractor or lower tier subcontractor, along with the individual who submitted a false certified payroll on the subcontractor's or lower tier subcontractor's behalf, shall be jointly and severally liable for the resulting damages and fees.

736.title: An Act Increasing Penalties On Employers For Refunds Of Wages In Exchange For Furnishing Employment.
736.description: To increase the penalty for employers who request or demand refunds of wages for furnishing employment to his or her employees.

737.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Commerce
737.title: An Act Requiring The Standard And Prevailing Wage Be Paid To Certain Employees Of Employers Who Received Financial Assistance From State Economic Development Entities.
737.description: To require any business organization receiving financial assistance from a state economic development entity to pay the standard wage to certain employees and require the business organization's contractors to pay the prevailing wage to his or her employees.

738.title: An Act Concerning Cooperative Health Care Arrangements.
738.description: To permit health care providers to enter into cooperative arrangements that would not be subject to certain antitrust laws after approval by the Attorney General, and to require managed care organizations to negotiate in good faith with providers who participate in such arrangements.

739.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
739.title: An Act Adding Members To The Joint Enforcement Commission On Worker Misclassification.
739.description: To add two members to the joint enforcement commission on employee misclassification.

740.title: An Act Concerning The Definition Of Employer In The Family And Medical Leave Act.
740.description: To clarify that the Family and Medical Leave Act only applies to employers employing seventy-five or more employees in the state.

741.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
741.title: An Act Concerning Notice To Parents Of Student Athletes About Concussions And Head Injuries.
741.description: To inform the parents and legal guardians of student athletes about concussions and head injuries.

742.title: An Act Concerning The Licensing, Investigation And Disciplinary Processes For Physicians And Nurses.
742.description: To expand the membership of the Connecticut Medical Examining Board; increase the number of continuing medical education credits for physicians; require renewal of physician, nurse and dentist licenses using the Department of Public Health's on-line license renewal system; and change the membership of the Connecticut State Board of Examiners for Nursing.

743.title: An Act Concerning The Electronic Death Registration System.
743.description: To require persons authorized to complete the medical certification portion of a death certificate to complete and submit such certification through the Department of Public Health's electronic death registration system.

744.title: An Act Concerning Financial Assistance To Local Health Departments For Lead Poisoning Prevention.
744.description: To describe the administration of the Department of Public Health's lead poisoning prevention and control program.

745.title: An Act Concerning Notice To The Departments Of Public Health And Education Regarding The Immunization Of School Children.
745.description: To require schools to report to the Departments Education and Public Health concerning children enrolled in schools who have not had the required immunizations.

746.title: An Act Establishing A Task Force To Study The Rights And Responsibilities Of Landlords And Tenants Regarding Bed Bug Infestation.
746.description: To establish landlord and tenant rights and responsibilities regarding bed bug infestations in rental housing.

747.title: An Act Making Technical Revisions To Statutes Concerning The Housing Committee.
747.description: To correct erroneous references in the general statutes to the Housing Committee as a select committee.

748.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
748.title: An Act Concerning Finalizing Adoptions By The Superior Court For Juvenile Matters.
748.description: To decrease the length of time between the termination of parental rights and adoption by allowing a petition for adoption to be filed in the Superior Court that granted the termination.

749.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Human Services
749.title: An Act Concerning Mandated Reporters And Requiring Criminal History Records Checks For Youth Camp Directors And Alternate Directors.
749.description: To expand the category of persons who are mandated reporters and to require criminal history records check for youth camp staff employees and volunteers.

750.title: An Act Concerning Jury Duty For Breastfeeding Mothers.
750.description: To allow the jury administrator to grant a postponement of jury duty for no more than twelve months to any mother who is breastfeeding her child or expressing breast milk for her child.

751.title: An Act Concerning The Storage Of Stolen Property By Law Enforcement Agencies And The Payment For Property Received By Precious Metals Or Stones Dealers.
751.description: To relieve local police departments of the administrative and financial burdens of inventorying and storing stolen property by raising the property value threshold that determines when the police must file an inventory and retain the property.

752.title: An Act Concerning The Recording Of Pistol And Revolver Sales In A Bound Book.
752.description: To eliminate the requirement that vendors of handguns maintain a record of each sale of a pistol or revolver in a form prescribed by the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection and instead require the record be maintained in accordance with federal regulations that require firearm dealers to keep a similar "bound book" record of each receipt and disposition of a firearm.

753.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
753.title: An Act Concerning Civil Air Patrol Funding.
753.description: To appropriate seventy-five thousand dollars from the General Fund to the Civil Air Patrol.

754.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
754.title: An Act Concerning Desecration Of War Or Veterans' Memorials.
754.description: To increase the penalties for the intentional desecration of war or veterans' memorials.

755.title: An Act Concerning Indemnification Of Municipalities For Demolition Claims.
755.description: To require an applicant for a demolition permit to furnish a written commitment by the demolition contractor that the town or city and its agents will be saved harmless from any claim arising from negligence of the applicant or his agents or employees during the demolition.

756.title: An Act Concerning The Membership Of The Coordinating Advisory Board To The Department Of Emergency Services And Public Protection.
756.description: To add the executive director of the Connecticut Council of Small Towns as a member of the Coordinating Advisory Board that was established to advise the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection on matters concerning communication and cooperation in the provision of emergency response services.

757.title: An Act Concerning Prepaid Cards.
757.description: To permit a purchaser of or individual who increases or reloads funds onto a general-use prepaid card, code or device to (1) receive back the unexpended balance and accrued interest on such balance by way of a financial account that is linked to such card, code or device, (2) receive back the unexpended balance and accrued interest in an expedited manner, and (3) transfer the unexpended balance to a bank offering a higher yield and insurance from the FDIC on such balance.

758.title: An Act Concerning Insurance Coverage For Hearing Aids.
758.description: To require insurance coverage for hearing aids for persons who have reached fifty-five years of age but have not reached sixty-five years of age.

759.title: An Act Requiring Payment For Diminution Of Value Under An Automobile Liability Insurance Policy.
759.description: To require insurers to include diminution of value in payments for damages caused to a third party's motor vehicle by an insurer's insured.

760.title: An Act Concerning The State Medical Loss Ratio.
760.description: To establish a civil penalty for a health care center or a health insurer that fails to provide the information required for the Consumer Report Card on Health Insurance Carriers in Connecticut, to amend the factors taken into account for calculation of the state medical loss ratio, and to establish a minimum state medical loss ratio of eighty-two per cent for certain individual and small employer group health insurance policies.

761.title: An Act Concerning Insurance Coverage For The Birth-to-three Program.
761.description: To amend sections 38a-490a and 38a-516a concerning health insurance coverage for birth-to-three programs to allow the state to establish a new baseline of state and local expenditures for early intervention services in the next federal fiscal year pursuant to federal regulations.

762.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorder Associated With Streptococcal Infections.
762.description: To require health insurance coverage for the diagnosis and treatment of pediatric autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorder associated with streptococcal infections.

763.title: An Act Concerning Residential Heating Oil And Propane Contracts.
763.description: To provide improved disclosure and increased options to prospective and current residential retail heating oil and propane customers.

764.title: An Act Concerning Reducing Inmate Health Care Costs.
764.description: To reduce correctional health care costs by ensuring maximum government reimbursement for eligible inmates and implementing account oversight measures.

765.title: An Act Increasing Educational Incentives In The Jobs First Employment Services Program.
765.description: To increase educational incentives for participants in the Jobs First employment services program.

766.title: An Act Allowing Municipalities Completing A Survey Of Unlicensed Dogs To Keep A Larger Portion Of Dog License Fees.
766.description: To allow municipalities completing a survey of unlicensed dogs to keep eighty per cent of dog license fees collected.

767.title: An Act Concerning Municipalities And Solid Waste Management.
767.description: To allow municipalities to regulate solid waste disposal within their borders.

768.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
768.title: An Act Concerning Provisional Ballots For State And Municipal Elections.
768.description: To make the provisional ballot system apply to state and municipal elections.

769.title: An Act Concerning Internet Access For Registrars Of Voters.
769.description: To ensure that registrars of voters may correspond with the Secretary of the State using electronic mail and to make technical changes.

770.title: An Act Concerning Permanent Absentee Ballot Status For The Permanently Disabled.
770.description: To make absentee ballot status permanent for the permanently physically disabled and to clarify instructions for the recipient of such status.

771.title: An Act Concerning Special Election Timing For Probate Judge Vacancies.
771.description: To provide that a special election to fill a vacancy for probate judge be conducted in the same timeline as that used for a special election to fill a vacancy for a member of the General Assembly and to provide that any probate judge who resigns, does so by notifying the Probate Court Administrator, in writing.

772.title: An Act Concerning Small Campaign Contributions To Nonparticipating Candidates.
772.description: To require that contributions from an individual, that in their aggregate do not exceed fifty dollars, be subject to disclosure requirements.

773.title: An Act Concerning Challengers As Polling Place Officials.
773.description: To eliminate the position of challenger as a polling place official.

774.title: An Act Concerning Polling Places For Primaries.
774.description: To permit small towns to reduce the number of polling places for primaries.

775.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
775.title: An Act Concerning The Neighborhood Assistance Act.
775.description: To enable certain business entities to qualify for credits under the Neighborhood Assistance Act.

776.title: An Act Concerning Navigation, Coastal Access And Clean Marinas.
776.description: To direct existing funding to dredging projects that improve navigation and public access while incentivizing clean marina practices and creating jobs.

777.title: An Act Concerning Certain Economic Incentives For Relocating Jobs That Are Outside Of The United States To The State.
777.description: To give preference in the first five plus program and other financial incentives to businesses that relocate jobs from outside of the United States to the state.

778.title: An Act Concerning A Regulatory Fairness Board.
778.description: To establish a Regulatory Fairness Board within the Department of Economic and Community Development.

779.title: An Act Concerning Infrastructure Projects To Support Business.
779.description: To require the Department of Economic and Community Development to explore certain public-private partnership infrastructure projects.

780.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
780.title: An Act Increasing The Competitiveness Of Small And Medium Businesses Through Research And Development.
