780.description: To require The University of Connecticut to establish a program to help state businesses develop innovations in manufacturing technologies.

781.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
781.title: An Act Authorizing An Updated Advanced Communications Technology Study.
781.description: To provide an updated study on the state's advanced communications technologies.

782.title: An Act Concerning Economic Development Entities And The Eb-5 Immigrant Investor Program.
782.description: To require the Department of Economic and Community Development to assist applicants seeking designation as regional centers for the purpose of attracting immigrant investors to the state and provide administrative and other services to designated regional centers, and allow regional centers to be temporarily eligible for any financial assistance or grant program administered by the Department of Economic and Community Development, Connecticut Development Authority and Connecticut Innovations, Incorporated.

783.title: An Act Concerning Corrections To Certain Census Designations.
783.description: To replace certain census tracts in the city of Bristol incorrectly identified as commercial property.

784.title: An Act Concerning Technical Revisions To Energy And Technology Statutes.
784.description: To implement technical revisions to various Energy and Technology statutes.

786.title: An Act Concerning Community Choices For Long-term Care And Disability Services.
786.description: To establish a single point of entry for information and services concerning aging and disability issues.

787.title: An Act Modifying The Katie Beckett Home Care Waiver Program.
787.description: To make technical modifications to a Medicaid waiver program for persons with disabilities to expand access and better define the population served.

788.title: An Act Concerning A Moratorium On Certain Long-term Care Beds.
788.description: To extend a moratorium on nursing home beds in keeping with a state plan to move more residents to community care settings.

789.title: An Act Concerning Advance Payments To Nursing Facilities For Uncompensated Care.
789.description: To mitigate financial hardships to nursing homes caused by delays in Medicaid eligibility determinations.

790.title: An Act Concerning Certain Social Services Programs.
790.description: To repeal statutes concerning obsolete subject matter.

791.title: An Act Concerning Municipal Agents For The Elderly.
791.description: To clarify duties of municipal agents to the elderly and training opportunities available.

792.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
792.title: An Act Concerning Reimbursement Of Emergency Room Physicians For Treatment Of Medicaid Recipients.
792.description: To provide payment to physicians who treat Medicaid recipients in emergency rooms but do not receive a salary or subsidy for those services.

793.title: An Act Concerning The Sharing Of Information Between The Labor Department And The Board Of Regents For Higher Education.
793.description: To permit the Labor Department to share wage and employment data with institutions of higher education for purposes of program evaluation.

794.title: An Act Expanding The Learn Here, Live Here Program.
794.description: To expand the Learn Here, Live Here program and change the name of the Connecticut first-time homebuyers account to the Learn Here, Live Here account.

795.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of The Distributions Of The Block Grant To The Regional Community-technical Colleges And The Connecticut State University System.
795.description: To require a study of issues concerning distributions of the block grant to the Connecticut State University System and the regional community-technical colleges.

796.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
796.title: An Act Allowing The Retention Of An Administrative Cost Allowance From The Connecticut Independent College Student Grant Program For Compliance Audits.
796.description: To allow the state to set aside up to thirty thousand dollars annually from the Connecticut Independent College Student Grant appropriation to fund the administration of compliance audits.

797.title: An Act Allowing Adjunct Faculty Members Of The Regional Community-technical College System To Waive Membership In A State Retirement Plan.
797.description: To permit adjunct faculty members of the regional community-technical colleges to waive membership in a Connecticut retirement plan just as adjunct faculty members employed by the Connecticut State University System or The University of Connecticut are permitted to do.

798.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
798.title: An Act Concerning A Study On The Release Of Faculty From Certain Teaching Requirements.
798.description: To require a study of issues concerning course releases and the feasibility and potential effects of reducing the number of faculty members who receive course releases.

799.title: An Act Concerning Certificates Of Merit.
799.description: To revise provisions concerning certificates of merit in medical malpractice actions.

800.title: An Act Concerning The Enhanced Penalty For The Sale Or Possession Of Drugs Near Schools, Day Care Centers And Public Housing Projects.
800.description: To revise the circumstances under which an enhanced penalty is imposed for the sale or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia near a school or a day care center, to eliminate the enhanced penalty for such sale or possession near a public housing project, and to allow judges more discretion in sentencing persons convicted of those offenses.

801.title: An Act Concerning The Recording Of Police Activity By The Public.
801.description: To protect the right of an individual to photograph or video record peace officers in the performance of their duties.

802.title: An Act Concerning Liability For Damage Caused By A Dog.
802.description: To (1) clarify that the owner or keeper of a dog that does damage to the companion animal of another is liable for the expense of veterinary care, the fair monetary value of the companion animal and the burial expenses for the companion animal, and (2) clarify the calculation of damages for damage done by a dog to domestic animals.

803.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
803.title: An Act Concerning The Sexual Assault Of A Person Whose Ability To Consent Is Substantially Impaired Due To Mental Disability.
803.description: To provide that sexual intercourse or sexual contact with a person whose ability to communicate lack of consent to such sexual activity is substantially impaired because of a mental or physical condition constitutes the crime of sexual assault.

804.title: An Act Concerning Probate Fees.
804.description: To: (1) Revise the calculation of probate fees in matters where the state has a claim against an estate due to support provided or costs of incarceration or institutionalization, (2) eliminate the additional charge of twenty-five dollars for each additional hearing or hour of hearing, (3) specify the fee for providing a digital copy of an audio recording of a hearing, (4) make conforming changes regarding statutory references to costs, charges and fees, and (5) repeal a provision regarding the method for determining a gross estate for purposes of computing fees for the settlement of estates.

805.title: An Act Concerning The Dismissal Of Deputy Chiefs Of Police.
805.description: To prohibit the dismissal of a deputy chief of police except by the chief of police with the approval of the authority that appoints the chief of police for that town.

806.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
806.title: An Act Excluding Veterans' Disability Compensation From Property Assignment And Alimony In Dissolution Of Marriage Proceedings.
806.description: To require the Superior Court to exclude disability compensation received by either party from the United States Department of Veterans Affairs from the amount and sources of income considered in determining orders for alimony or property assignment in an action for marital dissolution, annulment or legal separation.

807.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
807.title: An Act Concerning Veterans' Jobs.
807.description: To increase job opportunities available to veterans by providing state grants and subsidies to businesses.

808.title: An Act Authorizing Flavoring Agents For Prescription Products.
808.description: To authorize the addition of flavoring agents to prescription products, subject to certain conditions.

809.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To The Animal Importation Statutes.
809.description: To revise the definition of "animal importer" to exclude any person who adopts a cat or dog while such animal is still out-of-state and to reduce the frequency of required veterinary examinations of imported cats or dogs prior to the sale, adoption or transfer of such animals.

810.title: An Act Concerning Sources Of Revenue For The Remediation Of The Raymark Superfund Site.
810.description: To reduce the effect that phosphate runoff has on the state's bodies of water by restricting the application of fertilizers that contain phosphate.

811.title: An Act Concerning Revisions To Statutes Concerning The Comptroller.
811.description: To require the report concerning the CORE-CT system be submitted biennially rather than annually, to repeal the CORE-CT policy board, to raise the threshold value of personal property reported in an agency's annual inventory to five thousand dollars, to require payment under the Claims Commissioner's order by the Department of Administrative Services, to require insurance company payments be paid to the Department of Administrative Services, to make a technical change to the statute concerning the Connecticut State Employees Retirement Commission and to require the State Insurance and Risk Management Board to be responsible for insuring the state building at the Eastern States Exposition.

812.last_action: Senate Recommitted to Government Administration and Elections
812.title: An Act Concerning The Timing Of Faculty Consulting Agreement Audits Under The Code Of Ethics.
812.description: To change the timing of audits of faculty consulting agreements from semiannually to annually and to make a technical change.

813.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Government Administration and Elections
813.title: An Act Concerning The Posting Of State Agency Regulations On The Internet.
813.description: To require state agency regulations to be posted on the Internet web site of the state agency adopting such regulations.

814.title: An Act Concerning An Increase In The Maximum Allowable Unemployment Compensation Trust Fund Balance.
814.description: To increase the amount of money that can be retained in the Unemployment Compensation Trust Fund.

815.title: An Act Establishing The Connecticut Healthcare Partnership.
815.description: To open the state employee insurance pool to municipal, small and nonprofit employers.

816.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
816.title: An Act Concerning Expansion Of The License Renewal Fee Waiver For Certain Retired Physicians.
816.description: To expand the license renewal fee waiver for physicians who provide volunteer medical services for a local health department, the United States Department of Veterans Affairs' Veterans Health Administration, a United States Coast Guard medical clinic or Doctors Without Borders.

817.title: An Act Concerning Natureopathic Medicine.
817.description: To allow persons practicing natureopathy to administer vitamin B-12 by injection.

818.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
818.title: An Act Concerning The Assessment Of Farm Machinery And Livestock And The Transfer Of Land Classified As Farm Land, Open Space Land, Forest Land And Maritime Heritage Land.
818.description: To make all horses and ponies exempt from property taxation; to increase the property tax exemption for farm machinery; to amend the date on which a qualified foresters report must be submitted; to require property owners to provide notice of an excepted transfer of land classified as farm land, open space land, forest land or maritime heritage land, and to make other changes concerning the assessment of such classified land.

819.title: An Act Concerning Liability Of Zoning Enforcement Officers.
819.description: To provide the same protections to zoning enforcement officers as are provided to other municipal employees.

820.title: An Act Authorizing Licensed Veterinarians To Euthanize Injured Wildlife.
820.description: To authorize licensed veterinarians to humanely euthanize certain wildlife when such wildlife is seriously injured as the result of a collision with a motor vehicle.

821.title: An Act Concerning The Taxation Of Refuse Exported From Connecticut.
821.description: To reduce the negative environmental effect of exporting solid waste and to provide fuel for in-state trash-to-energy facilities.

822.last_action: Referred to Joint Committee on Environment
822.title: An Act Authorizing The Inclusion Of Nurseries And Greenhouses In Farmland Preservation Programs.
822.description: To specifically authorize the inclusion of nurseries and greenhouses in the Department of Agriculture's farmland preservation programs.

823.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
823.title: An Act Concerning Clean And Alternative Fuel Vehicles.
823.description: To extend certain sales tax exemptions, gross earnings tax exemptions and tax credits to promote the sale, distribution and use of clean and alternative fuels.

824.title: An Act Requiring Retailers To Disclose Specific Absorption Rates For Cellular Telephones.
824.description: To require retailers to disclose specific absorption rates for cellular mobile telephones.

825.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
825.title: An Act Concerning A Structural Engineer License Endorsement And Requiring Continuing Professional Education For Professional Engineers.
825.description: To establish a structural engineer endorsement to the professional engineer license and to require professional engineers and land surveyors to complete not less than fifteen hours per calendar year of continuing professional education.

826.title: An Act Concerning Consumer Protection.
826.description: To protect consumers from unfair business practices.

827.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
827.title: An Act Concerning The Liquor Control Act.
827.description: To require the Commissioner of Consumer Protection to study the types of current alcoholic liquor permits and the need for such permits.

828.title: An Act Concerning Social Security Support For Foster Children.
828.description: To ensure all children in foster care are screened for their eligibility for federal Social Security benefits, to require the Department of Children and Families to apply for Supplemental Security Income on behalf of a child in its care and custody, and to require the department to determine whether a child will require a representative payee.

829.title: An Act Concerning The Care 4 Kids Program.
829.description: To make changes to the Care4Kids subsidy program to allow minor parents attending high school to be eligible for the program, allow women on maternity leave to continue to receive Care4Kids during their leave, extend the eligibility to unemployed recipients seeking employment, and to adjust payment rates for the program.

830.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
830.title: An Act Concerning Chemicals Of Concern To Children.
830.description: To identify chemicals of high concern to children.

831.title: An Act Concerning Workplace Violence Prevention And Reporting.
831.description: To make changes to the statute concerning workplace violence prevention and reporting.

832.title: An Act Concerning Licensing Requirements For Acupuncturists.
832.description: To update licensing requirements for acupuncturists in accordance with national standards.

833.title: An Act Establishing A Council To Promote Collaboration Between Local Health Departments And The Department Of Public Health.
833.description: To establish an advisory council to promote collaboration between the Department of Public Health, local health departments and health districts.

834.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
834.title: An Act Concerning Membership Of The Board Of Examiners For Physical Therapists.
834.description: To change the membership on the Board of Examiners for Physical Therapists.

835.title: An Act Concerning Sentence Modification.
835.description: To permit a sentenced person to seek review and modification of his or her sentence regardless of whether the state's attorney agrees to such review.

836.title: An Act Revising The Penalty For Capital Felonies.
836.description: To replace the death penalty with a penalty of life imprisonment without the possibility of release for certain murders committed on or after the effective date of this act.

837.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
837.title: An Act Concerning A Report On The Survey Of Accessibility In And To State Buildings.
837.description: To require state buildings to meet the requirements of the federal Americans with Disabilities Act by 2018.

838.title: An Act Concerning The Return Of A Gift To A Person In Need Of Long-term Care Services.
838.description: To allow the Department of Social Services to reduce the length of a penalty period when only part of a gift has been returned to an institutionalized individual.

839.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Human Services
839.title: An Act Concerning The Treatment Of Benefits Received Under The Veterans' Aid And Attendance Improved Pension.
839.description: To exempt aid and attendance benefits from income eligibility determinations under the Connecticut energy assistance program and to allow the Department of Social Services to apply for a waiver to exempt the benefits from income eligibility for the state supplement and medical assistance programs.

840.title: An Act Creating A Childhood Immunization Task Force.
840.description: To establish a task force to develop a plan to provide immunizations to children in the state, in accordance with federal initiatives, and to consider whether universal immunization for children in the state should continue.

841.title: An Act Concerning The Macbride Principles.
841.description: To give the State Treasurer greater discretion in divesting investments in companies that fail to adopt the MacBride principles and to sunset the requirement for such divestures after January 1, 2020.

842.title: An Act Exempting Institutions Of Higher Education That Offer Free Courses To Inmates From State Contracting Requirements.
842.description: To exempt institutions of higher education that arrange for professors to teach free for-credit courses to inmates from state contracting requirements.

843.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
843.title: An Act Concerning Local Pharmacies.
843.description: To allow state employees to purchase or receive pharmaceutical products from local pharmacies.

844.title: An Act Requiring A Study Of Radio-frequency Identification For Motor Vehicle Registration.
844.description: To direct the Department of Motor Vehicles to study the use of radio-frequency identification for motor vehicle registrations.

845.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of Tolls For The Extension Of Route 11.
845.description: To authorize the imposition of tolls on the extension of Route 11.

846.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
846.title: An Act Authorizing Bonds Of The State For A Parking Structure In The Town Of Milford.
846.description: To authorize bonds of the state for a parking structure in Milford.

847.title: An Act Establishing A Youth Employment System.
847.description: To further develop, enhance and expand employment opportunities for youth, support career pathways to provide youth and young adults with education, skills and access to good jobs and successful careers, and establish a public-private partnership to encourage the employment of talented and experienced youth and young adults.

848.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
848.title: An Act Aligning Connecticut's Intellectual Capital With The Business Community.
848.description: To develop an occupational job training program and an assessment system to ensure the alignment of Connecticut's intellectual capital with the needs of the business community.

849.title: An Act Concerning Permanency And Transition Plans.
849.description: To ensure permanency plan documents and hearings include information regarding what steps the department has taken to make any necessary referrals for children under five years of age to early intervention, preschool, or special education services, steps taken to enable a child sixteen years of age or older to learn independent living skills and complete a secondary education or vocation program, and steps taken to develop a personalized transition plan for children between the ages of sixteen and eighteen.

850.title: An Act Concerning Children And The Department Of Children And Families.
850.description: To require employees of the Department of Children and Families to visit foster homes and the homes of children or youth every sixty days and to require the department to respond to foster families' written special requests in a timely manner.

851.title: An Act Concerning The Transportation Of Siblings As Passengers By Drivers Under The Age Of Eighteen.
851.description: To alter the graduated driver's license system to allow a person who is sixteen or seventeen years of age, after being issued a motor vehicle operator's license, to transport both such person's parents and siblings in the vehicle at the same time and to allow a person to transport such person's siblings without a parent present in the vehicle to and from school and extracurricular activities between the hours of 6:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m.

852.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Judiciary
852.title: An Act Providing Certain Adult Adopted Persons With Access To Parental Health Information And Information In Their Original Birth Certificate.
852.description: To provide adult adopted persons, twenty-one years of age or older, access to their biological parents' health information and information in the person's original birth certificate or record.

853.title: An Act Concerning Regional Educational Service Centers.
853.description: To require regional educational service centers to maintain fingerprints and other positive identifying information for a period of four years.

854.title: An Act Concerning The Minimum Budget Requirement.
854.description: To require a study of issues involving the minimum budget requirement.

855.title: An Act Concerning Minor Revisions To The Education Statutes.
855.description: To make minor revisions to the education statutes relating to Junior Reserve Officer Training Corps program instructors and school building projects for incorporated or endowed high schools or academies.

856.title: An Act Concerning Early Childhood Education.
856.description: To establish universal access to preschool.

857.title: An Act Concerning The Open Choice Program.
857.description: To provide transportation funding to regional educational service centers for students participating in the open choice program.

858.title: An Act Concerning Technical Revisions To The Education Statutes.
858.description: To make technical revisions to the education statutes.

859.title: An Act Concerning Boards Of Education.
859.description: To clarify the relationship between the reconstitution of boards of education and the electoral process.

860.title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of Labor History In The Public School Curriculum.
860.description: To include labor history in the prescribed courses of study in the public school curriculum.

861.title: An Act Concerning The Inclusion Of Personal Financial Management In The Public School Curriculum.
861.description: To include personal financial management in the prescribed courses of study in the public school curriculum.

862.title: An Act Concerning Executions On Judgments.
862.description: To conform state law protection of moneys exempt from execution to federally-required procedures.

863.title: An Act Concerning The Inheritance Rights Of A Beneficiary Or Survivor Who Is Found Not Guilty Of Murdering The Deceased By Reason Of Mental Disease Or Defect.
863.description: To prohibit a person found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect of causing the death of a decedent from benefiting from the estate of the decedent or from the decedent's life insurance policy or annuity.

864.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of A Business Data Collection Center.
864.description: To establish the business data collection center as the state's central repository for business and economic-related data.

865.title: An Act Concerning Probate Court Operations.
865.description: To: (1) Codify existing practices regarding retirement contributions and calculations for administrative judges for regional children's probate courts and special assignment probate judges; (2) require the Probate Court Administrator to submit business reports to the Chief Court Administrator biennially, rather than annually; (3) provide for a probate court officer to perform certain functions in regional children's probate court matters; (4) replace "temporary administrators" with "estate examiners" with respect to certain limited investigatory powers; and (5) revise various probate court operation provisions, including those related to costs for estates of nondomiciliary testators, transfer of proceedings, review of guardianships for persons with intellectual disability, and service of process on nonresident fiduciaries.

866.last_action: House Passed as Amended by Senate Amendment Schedule A,B
866.title: An Act Concerning The Removal Of Individuals From The State Child Abuse And Neglect Registry.
866.description: To establish a procedure for individuals to remove their names from the state child abuse and neglect registry after five years have elapsed and upon the showing of good cause.

867.title: An Act Concerning The Revisor's Technical Corrections To The General Statutes.
867.description: To make various technical changes concerning grammar, clarity, accuracy of internal references and consistency in the general statutes.

868.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Housing
868.title: An Act Providing Veterans' Preferences In The Rental Assistance Program And Housing Authority Projects.
868.description: To give preference in affordable or subsidized housing admission to veterans meeting the federal veterans' preference requirements.

869.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
869.title: An Act Concerning Start-up Farmers Who Are Veterans Of The Armed Forces.
869.description: To aid veterans in starting or expanding agricultural businesses by providing a limited exemption from the sales and use tax and including farmers in the Connecticut Farm Link program.

870.title: An Act Concerning Issues Affecting The Veterans' Community.
870.description: To address issues affecting the veterans' community.

871.title: An Act Prohibiting The Unnecessary Collection Of Social Security Numbers.
871.description: To prohibit the unnecessary collection of Social Security numbers.

872.title: An Act Concerning Notification Of The Expiration Of Trial Offers, Introductory Rates And Automatic Contract Renewals.
872.description: To require notification of the expiration of introductory rates, trial periods and automatic subscription renewals.

873.title: An Act Exempting Certain Distribution Warehouse Employees From Professional Licensing Requirements.
873.description: To exempt certain distribution warehouse employees from the licensing requirements of chapter 393 of the general statutes.

874.title: An Act Concerning Single Limit Liability Passenger Motor Vehicle Insurance Policies.
874.description: To prohibit insurers from offering single limit of liability automobile liability insurance policies for passenger motor vehicles.

875.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
875.title: An Act Exempting Certain Individuals From Casualty Adjuster Licensing Requirements.
875.description: To exempt certain individuals from casualty adjuster licensing requirements.

876.title: An Act Concerning Fire Prevention Code Regulations.
876.description: To delay the scheduled effective date for the revision and repeal of certain statutes dependent upon the adoption of fire prevention regulations.

877.last_action: Senate Recommitted to Public Safety and Security
877.title: An Act Concerning The Development And Implementation Of A Strategic Highway Safety Plan.
877.description: To require the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection to develop and implement a strategic plan to reduce vehicle-related fatalities and injuries.

878.title: An Act Concerning Emergency Medical Dispatch Training.
878.description: To exempt a public safety answering point from the requirement to provide emergency medical dispatch training and continuing education to its personnel if that facility has arranged with another entity for the provision of emergency medical dispatch services.

879.title: An Act Concerning Crane Operations.
879.description: To revise license and certification requirements for crane and hoisting equipment operators.

880.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
880.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Emergency Services And Public Protection.
880.description: To make technical and conforming changes to certain statutes resulting from the consolidation of agencies and the establishment of the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection.

881.title: An Act Concerning The Failure To Comply With Mandatory Evacuation Orders.
881.description: To impose criminal and civil liability upon a person who fails to comply with a mandatory evacuation order.

882.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
882.title: An Act Concerning Mixed Martial Arts.
882.description: To permit professional mixed martial arts matches to be held in the state and subject such matches to the same regulation that currently applies to boxing matches, including giving the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection regulatory authority over such matches, requiring the licensing of the sponsors of and participants in such matches, imposing a tax upon the receipts of such matches and requiring compliance with other safety requirements.

883.title: An Act Concerning Fire Safety Enforcement Officials.
883.description: To streamline the process for the certification of fire safety enforcement officials, recognize training programs offered by private institutions, authorize local fire marshals to delegate their authority to subordinates with respect to all fire safety regulations and authorize communities to appoint fire inspectors and investigators.

884.last_action: Disagreeing Action, Tabled for Calendar, Senate
884.title: An Act Concerning Technical And Other Changes To The Labor Department Statutes.
884.description: To make technical and other changes to the Labor Department statutes.

885.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
885.title: An Act Concerning A Surety Bond Guarantee Program For Emerging Contractors.
885.description: To require the commissioners of certain state contracting agencies to submit a report on issues relating to surety bonds.

886.title: An Act Concerning The Employers Of Individuals Providing Homemaker Services, Companion Services And Homemaker-home Health Aide Services.
886.description: To designate a homemaker-companion agency, registry or homemaker-home health agency as the employer of individuals providing certain services to consumers for the purposes of unemployment compensation, wages and workers' compensation, and remove liability for such individual's personal injuries arising out of and in the course of employment from the consumer.

887.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
887.title: An Act Providing A Tax Credit For Certain Employers Of Veterans.
887.description: To increase supportive housing options available to homeless veterans.

888.title: An Act Concerning Utility Service Termination And The Appointment Of A Receiver.
888.description: To permit utility termination on certain Fridays and to allow utility companies to seek appointment of a receiver for certain nursing home facilities.

889.title: An Act Concerning The Membership Of The Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority's Board Of Directors And Establishing A Task Force Concerning The Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority.
889.description: To alter the makeup of the Connecticut Resources Recovery Authority's board of directors.

890.title: An Act Concerning Desecration Of Property.
890.description: To strengthen the criminal penalties associated with desecration of property.

891.title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommendations For Technical And Minor Corrections To The Public Safety Statutes.
891.description: To make certain technical and minor corrections to various statutes on subject matters within the cognizance of the Public Safety and Security committee.

892.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Judiciary
892.title: An Act Concerning Negligent Hunting And Trespassing For Purposes Of Hunting, Trapping Or Fishing.
892.description: To establish a minimum fine for negligent hunting in the second and third degree.

893.title: An Act Concerning The Silver Alert System.
893.description: To allow information about a person who is missing from an inpatient facility of the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services to be disseminated in order to assist in the location of such missing person.

894.title: An Act Concerning Public Safety.
894.description: To make certain changes to statutes concerning civil preparedness and emergency services.

895.title: An Act Revising Statutes Concerning The Department Of Administrative Services.
895.description: To repeal certain obsolete boards and committees, to eliminate or modify various reporting requirements, to eliminate a requirement that the department monitor certain fees under the Freedom of Information Act, to eliminate a requirement that the department adopt regulations concerning fee schedules for workers' compensation claims and to transfer the requirement of maintaining an inventory of state leased property to the Office of Policy and Management.

896.title: An Act Concerning The Use By State Employees Of Services Provided By Connecticut Technical High School System Students.
896.description: To permit public officials, state employees and their immediate family members to contract, outside of the normal bidding process, with the regional-technical school system for the provision of services by students that exceed one hundred dollars in value.

897.title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommendations For Technical Revisions To The Government Administration And Elections Statutes.
897.description: To implement the Legislative Commissioners' Office's recommendations for technical revisions to the government administration statutes.

898.title: An Act Concerning The Development Of An Internet Web Site For The Washington-rochambeau Revolutionary Route National Historic Trail.
898.description: To qualify for a grant from the National Park Service to develop a web site to highlight that portion of the Washington-Rochambeau Revolutionary Route National Historic Trail that travels through Connecticut.

899.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
899.title: An Act Concerning Intervention In Permit Proceedings Pursuant To The Environmental Protection Act Of 1971.
899.description: To amend substantive and evidentiary requirements for a verified pleading filed by a person seeking to intervene in an administrative proceeding or legal action pursuant to the Environmental Protection Act of 1971.

900.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
900.title: An Act Concerning Community Economic Development.
900.description: To promote economic development in distressed municipalities.

902.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
902.title: An Act Creating A Regional Composting Facility Siting Task Force.
902.description: To establish a task force that will provide guidance as to the most appropriate sites on which to locate a regional composting facility.

903.title: An Act Concerning The State's Open Space Plan.
903.description: To revise the state's open space plan by increasing the frequency of revisions to such plan, identifying lands appropriate for preservation as open space that are held by state agencies and water companies, identifying lands of highest priority for conservation and making recommendations for the establishment of a system to accurately keep track of lands preserved as open space.

904.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Energy and Technology
904.title: An Act Concerning Water Conservation.
904.description: To authorize water company rates that support conservation measures and investments in infrastructure which promote water and energy conservation.

905.title: An Act Concerning Training For Inland Wetlands Agency Members And Agents.
905.description: To provide training to a larger number of inland wetlands agency members and agents.

906.title: An Act Requiring The Establishment Of Manufacturer Mercury Thermostat Collection And Recycling Programs.
906.description: To establish a manufacturer-based system of collecting and recycling out-of-service mercury thermostats.

907.title: An Act Concerning Certain Cemetery Erosion Mitigation Efforts Within The Coastal Boundary And The Appeal Of Certain Decisions Under The Water Pollution Control Act.
907.description: To enable the erection of structures to mitigate erosion that threatens certain cemetery grounds within the coastal boundary.

908.title: An Act Creating A Process For Family Child Care Providers To Collectively Bargain With The State.
908.description: To provide a process for family child care providers to collectively bargain with the state.

909.title: An Act Concerning The State's Second Injury Fund.
909.description: To permit the Second Injury Fund to seek writs of attachment from a workers' compensation commissioner against an uninsured employer when it is likely that a finding and award will enter against the Second Injury Fund.

910.title: An Act Concerning The Enhanced Emergency 9-1-1 Program.
910.description: To impose a fifty cent fee on each purchase of prepaid wireless telecommunications services from a retailer to pay for the enhanced emergency 9-1-1 program.

911.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
911.title: An Act Concerning The Revenues From The Petroleum Products Gross Earnings Tax And Providing An Additional Exemption From Said Tax.
911.description: To update the statute to refer to the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA), which is the successor organization to the National Association of Securities Dealers (NASD).

912.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
912.title: An Act Expanding The Neighborhood Assistance Act.
912.description: To enable business entities to qualify for credits under the Neighborhood Assistance Act.

913.title: An Act Concerning Various Statutes Pertaining To The Department Of Revenue Services.
913.description: To authorize a limited disclosure of return information in state personnel proceedings, to increase the threshold for review of penalty waivers from five hundred dollars to one thousand dollars, and to make technical changes to the captive insurer provisions adopted in the October special session.

914.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
914.title: An Act Encouraging Increased Savings Deposits.
914.description: To encourage individuals who do not normally save money to begin making or to increase the frequency of their deposits into a savings account or other savings program offered by Connecticut credit unions.

915.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Education
915.title: An Act Concerning Financial Literacy.
915.description: To ensure that students of public high schools and public institutions of higher education in this state receive instruction in financial literacy.

916.last_action: House Adopted Senate Amendment Schedule A
916.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Connecticut Housing Finance Authority Task Force.
916.description: To adopt the recommendations made by the task force established to evaluate loss mitigation programs administered by the Connecticut Housing Finance Authority.

917.title: An Act Concerning Regulatory Relief For The Connecticut Check Cashing Industry.
917.description: To foster a healthy and regulated financial services industry by (1) establishing a fifty-thousand-dollar net worth and liquidity requirement for new licensees and, after a three-year phase in, existing licensees, (2) eliminating the prohibition on cashing checks exceeding six thousand dollars, and (3) establishing a three per cent base fee limitation.

918.title: An Act Concerning Debt Negotiators.
918.description: To permit a debt negotiator to charge a maximum of thirty per cent of the amount by which such debt negotiator reduces a consumer's debt.

919.title: An Act Concerning Economic Opportunity.
919.description: To establish (1) an infrastructure and economic development bank as a subsidiary of the Connecticut Development Authority, and (2) a housing and economic development collaborative.

920.title: An Act Concerning Traffic Stop Information.
920.description: To enhance compliance with data collection and reporting required under the Alvin W. Penn Racial Profiling Prohibition Act.

921.title: An Act Concerning The Statute Of Limitations In Carbon Monoxide Poisoning Cases.
921.description: To extend the statute of limitations for personal injury claims emanating from exposure to carbon monoxide.

922.title: An Act Concerning The Administrator Of The Interstate Compact For Adult Offender Supervision.
922.description: To eliminate the statutory requirement that the Commissioner of Correction act as administrator of the Interstate Compact for Adult Offender Supervision, and allow for the Governor or the State Council for Interstate Adult Offender Supervision to appoint a compact administrator in accordance with the terms of the compact.

923.title: An Act Concerning Public Indecency In A Correctional Institution.
923.description: To establish a criminal offense of public indecency in a correctional institution and require offenders to register with the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection as a nonviolent sexual offender.

924.title: An Act Concerning A Report By The Health Information Technology Exchange Of Connecticut.
924.description: To specify the circumstances under which a patient's health information may be disclosed through the state's electronic health information system.

925.title: An Act Concerning Authorization For The Use Of Feeding Tubes And Antiepileptic Medications In School Settings.
925.description: To authorize unlicensed personnel to administer tube feedings and antiepileptic medications to certain children attending public and nonpublic schools.

926.title: An Act Concerning Services Provided By Genetic Counselors.
926.description: To allow certified genetic counselors to provide genetic counseling services under certain circumstances.

927.title: An Act Concerning The Administration Of Injectable Vaccines To Adults In Pharmacies.
927.description: To allow pharmacists to administer to adults vaccines that are listed on the National Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's adult immunization schedule under certain circumstances.

928.title: An Act Concerning The Provision Of Body Modification Services To Minors.
928.description: To prohibit the provision of certain types of body modification services to a minor without the permission of the minor's parent or legal guardian.

929.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
929.title: An Act Concerning Health And Safety In Child Care Facilities.
929.description: To require, within available appropriations, annual inspections of day care centers, group day care homes and family day care homes.

930.title: An Act Concerning A Study Of Funding And Support For Home And Community-based Care For The Elderly And Alzheimer's Patients.
930.description: To study funding available to elderly persons and persons with Alzheimer's disease for care at home or in the community.

931.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
931.title: An Act Concerning Reimbursement Under The Underground Storage Tank Petroleum Clean-up Program.
931.description: To gradually eliminate the state fund and state assurance for reimbursement of costs associated with a release from an underground petroleum storage tank, to prioritize payment of approved applications for reimbursement of costs associated with a release from an underground storage tank and to terminate the underground storage tank petroleum clean-up review board.

932.title: An Act Concerning The Coastal Management Act And Shoreline Flood And Erosion Control Structures.
932.description: To clarify the right of property owners to construct shoreline flood and erosion control structures.

933.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
933.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of State Agencies Providing Public Health, Mental Health And Developmental Services.
933.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by state agencies providing public health, mental health or developmental services.

934.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
934.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The Department Of Correction.
934.description: To review the programs and services administered or provided by the Department of Correction.

935.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of The Judicial Department, The Division Of Criminal Justice And The Public Defender Services Commission.
935.description: To review expenditures of the Judicial Department, the Division of Criminal Justice and the Public Defender Services Commission.

936.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
936.title: An Act Concerning Expenditures Of Appropriated Funds Other Than The General Fund.
936.description: To review appropriations from appropriated funds other than the General Fund.

937.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
937.title: An Act Creating A Task Force To Study Low-income Adults And Medication Administration.
937.description: To establish a task force to study the Medicaid for Low-Income Adults program and the administration of medication by unlicensed personnel who work for home health care agencies.

938.title: An Act Concerning Teacher Certification.
938.description: To require endorsements to each elementary education grades one to six, to be valid only for grades one to six.

939.title: An Act Concerning Manufacturing And Mechanical Internships.
939.description: To permit a minor sixteen years of age and over who is participating in a manufacturing internship to work in any manufacturing establishment.

940.title: An Act Concerning Teacher Preparation.
940.description: To enhance teacher preparation requirements to ensure that every individual graduating from a teacher preparation leading to professional certification is better qualified to teach students and ensure that Connecticut students receive the best possible education.

941.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Labor and Public Employees
941.title: An Act Concerning Owner Operators In The Motor Carrier Industry.
941.description: To apply the independent contractor standard to owner operators in the motor carrier industry.

942.title: An Act Concerning The Sale, Via Internet Auction, Of License Plates Issued By The Department Of Motor Vehicles.
942.description: To develop a program for the online sale of number plates issued by the Department of Motor Vehicles.

943.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Government Administration and Elections
943.title: An Act Concerning The Use Of Remanufactured Parts For The Maintenance And Repair Of The State's Motor Vehicle Fleet.
943.description: To encourage the use of recycled, remanufactured and aftermarket parts for the repair of the state fleet.

944.title: An Act Concerning Warranties Applicable To Vessels And Marine Engines.
944.description: To expand the state Lemon Law to include boats in order to give boat owners the opportunity to have their money refunded if the purchased boat does not meet performance standards.

945.title: An Act Redefining Executive Sessions Under The Freedom Of Information Act To Permit Certain Confidential Communications.
945.description: To permit executive sessions for the purpose of discussing the oral or written legal advice of a government attorney under the Freedom of Information Act and to limit the exception for oral communications to confidential communications.

946.title: An Act Concerning The Purview Of The Legislative Regulation Review Committee.
946.description: To expand the purview of the legislative regulation review committee to permit the committee to direct an agency to amend or repeal any regulation the committee finds to be obsolete or outdated, or too onerous on the regulated community.

947.title: An Act Expanding Access By Veterans To Public Assistance Programs.
947.description: To expand veteran access to public assistance programs by exempting federal Aid and Attendance pension benefits from income.

948.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
948.title: An Act Concerning Pharmacy Reimbursement.
948.description: To expand consumer options by establishing more equitable reimbursement rates for pharmacies.

949.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
949.title: An Act Concerning Repayment Of State Aid By A Recipient Whose Death Is Caused By The State's Negligence.
949.description: To prevent the state from recouping public assistance payments from the proceeds of a cause of action brought by or on behalf of a recipient whose death was caused by the state's negligence.

950.title: An Act Concerning Medicaid Eligibility And The Identification And Recovery Of Assets.
950.description: To clarify asset identification and recovery procedures in Medicaid eligibility determinations.

952.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of Community-based Social Services.
952.description: To change the social services delivery system from a state-based to a municipal-based model.

953.last_action: Favorable Change of Reference, House to Committee on Appropriations
953.title: An Act Amending The Medicaid State Plan To Include Chiropractic Treatment As An Optional Service.
953.description: To add chiropractic treatment as an optional service covered under the Medicaid state plan.

954.title: An Act Concerning Inmate Discharge Savings Accounts.
954.description: To make clarifying, technical and conforming changes to provisions concerning the establishment, accumulation and disbursement of inmate discharge savings accounts that are payable to the inmate upon release from incarceration.

956.title: An Act Concerning The Taxation Of Digital Products.
956.description: To include digital movies, books, music, ringtones, audio and video works and similar downloadable products as subject to the sales and use tax.

957.title: An Act Concerning Livery Service.
957.description: To equalize the taxation of for-profit transportation services.

958.title: An Act Concerning The Department Of Economic And Community Development's Economic Strategic Plan.
958.description: To require a report on how to facilitate a green chemical industry in this state and to change the requirements of the Department of Economic and Community Development's economic strategic plan.

959.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
959.title: An Act Concerning Low-profit Limited Liability Companies.
959.description: To allow for the organization of low-profit limited liability companies.

960.title: An Act Concerning The Legislative Commissioners' Recommendations For Technical Corrections To Commerce Statutes.
960.description: To make technical corrections to various commerce statutes.

961.title: An Act Concerning Targeted Health Areas.
961.description: To establish a Targeted Health Area program and provide economic incentives to licensed physicians and physician offices providing primary care services or needed medical specialties in such targeted health areas.

962.title: An Act Requiring The Commissioner Of Transportation To Waive Certain Insurance Requirements For Beautification Efforts On State Property Along A Highway.
962.description: To waive certain insurance requirements in order to allow the Fairmont Neighborhood Association to participate in a beautification program, and to hold the Commissioner of Transportation and the state harmless in the event anyone is injured while participating in such program.

963.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Banks
963.title: An Act Concerning The Assignment Of Mortgage Debts.
963.description: To require any assignment of a mortgage debt to be recorded not later than sixty days after such assignment.

964.title: An Act Concerning A Task Force To Study Health Care For Uninsured Children.
964.description: To establish a task force to study the establishment of additional programs to provide health care to uninsured children in this state.

965.title: An Act Concerning Disclosures For Universal Life Insurance Policies.
965.description: To require certain disclosures to be provided for a universal life insurance policy or similar policy that reserves the right to periodically increase the cost of insurance, and to allow the issuance of annuity policies that provide long-term care benefits.

966.title: An Act Concerning Adverse Determination Reviews.
966.description: To require health carriers and independent review organizations to provide free of charge to covered persons or covered persons' authorized representatives copies of all materials regarding an adverse determination or a final adverse determination, and to require dispensation and coverage of a prescribed drug for the duration of any grievance or review.

967.title: An Act Concerning The Insurance Holding Company System Regulatory Act.
967.description: To update the insurance statutes concerning insurance holding company systems to enhance the Insurance Department's financial surveillance and oversight of insurance companies.

968.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
968.title: An Act Implementing The Recommendations Of The Program Review And Investigations Committee Concerning The Regulation Of Embalmers And Funeral Service Establishments And Certain Professional Board And Commission Hearings.
968.description: To implement the recommendations of the Legislative Program Review and Investigations Committee (1) to require funeral service establishments and embalmers to distribute fact sheets concerning funeral service contracts and to establish a funeral service contract guaranty fund to reimburse consumers for purchased contracts where the establishment did not deposit the funds in an escrow account as required by law, and (2) to require one public and one professional board or commission member to be present at certain professional board hearings.

969.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Energy and Technology
969.title: An Act Concerning Bonding Authority For The Connecticut Clean Energy Authority.
969.description: To authorize the Connecticut Clean Energy Authority to issue it's own bonds and clean energy bonds, to establish special capital reserve funds, and to be subject to the same statutory provisions as other quasi-public entities.

970.title: An Act Concerning Advanced Practice Registered Nurses' Certification Or Signature.
970.description: To allow an advanced practice registered nurse to sign, certify or give an authorization where a physician is allowed or required to do so.

971.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
971.title: An Act Concerning The Operations Of The Department Of Energy And Environmental Protection, The Establishment Of A Commercial Property Assessed Clean Energy Program, Water Conservation And The Operations Of The Clean Energy Finance And Investment Authority.
971.description: To implement the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection's recommended revisions to Connecticut's energy statutes, to establish a commercial property assessed clean energy program, to promote water conservation, to clarify the quasi-public status of the Clean Energy Finance and Investment Authority and to change the name of said authority to the Connecticut Clean Energy Authority, to authorize the Connecticut Clean Energy Authority to issue its own bonds and establish capital reserve funds, and to implement the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority's recommended revisions to the utility statutes.

972.title: An Act Concerning Mergers And Acquisitions Of The Holding Companies Of Certain Public Utility Companies.
972.description: To expand the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority's jurisdiction over the mergers and acquisitions of the holding companies of certain utility companies.

973.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
973.title: An Act Concerning Juvenile Matters And Permanent Guardianships.
973.description: To: (1) Establish a process for determining competency of a child or youth in a juvenile matter; (2) clarify the procedure for genetic testing reporting of paternity adjudications in certain juvenile matters; (3) clarify the primary role of counsel for a child who is unable to communicate with counsel and is the subject of a neglect or abuse petition; (4) eliminate certain placements for children convicted as delinquent; (5) establish permanent legal guardianships and permanent guardianships intended to endure until the child attains the age of majority; (6) eliminate automatic transfers from the juvenile docket to the regular criminal docket for class B felony cases, and require the juvenile court to make certain enumerated findings prior to transferring a case where a child is charged with a class B, C or D felony or unclassified felony to the regular criminal docket; and (7) revise other procedures in juvenile matters.

974.title: An Act Adopting The Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act And The Uniform Certificate Of Title For Vessels Act.
974.description: To adopt the Uniform Electronic Legal Material Act and the Uniform Certificate of Title for Vessels Act in this state.

975.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
975.title: An Act Concerning Responsible Party Agreements And The Maintenance Of Professional Liability Insurance By Nursing Homes, Home Health Care Agencies And Homemaker-home Health Aide Agencies.
975.description: To (1) require a nursing home facility to fully and fairly inform an applicant for admission to such facility, the applicant's relatives and other responsible parties of their obligations in connection with an admission to the facility; and (2) require nursing homes, home health care agencies and homemaker-home health aide agencies to maintain professional liability insurance at certain prescribed levels.

976.title: An Act Concerning The Qualifications For Candidates Seeking Election To The Office Of The Attorney General.
976.description: To clarify that the qualification for election to the office of the Attorney General be admission to the bar of this state for a continuous period of at least ten years immediately prior to taking office, and to delete an obsolete reference to the location of the office of the Attorney General.

977.title: An Act Concerning An Accident Report For A Motor Vehicle Accident In Which A Person Was Killed.
977.description: To provide that an investigation of an accident report completed with respect to a motor vehicle accident in which any person was killed shall contain the investigating officer's recommendations for further investigation or action.

978.title: An Act Concerning Apportionment Of Damages In Workers' Compensation Cases.
978.description: To revise the methodology of calculating reimbursement to an employer that has paid workers' compensation benefits to an injured employee when the employee brings an action against a third-party tortfeasor and recovers damages.

979.title: An Act Concerning Court Fees Paid By The State And Service Of Process Requirements In Civil Actions Commenced Against The State By Persons Who Are Incarcerated.
979.description: To (1) specify the amount of fees paid by the Judicial Branch to proper officers serving process pursuant to section 46b-15 of the general statutes; (2) reduce the service of process expenditures incurred by the state when an incarcerated person files a cause of action against the state or a state entity; and (3) provide the court with the authority to waive court fees in nonfrivolous matters involving indigent parties.

980.title: An Act Establishing A Pilot Program To Implement An Electronic Prescribing System And Develop A Standardized Prior Authorization Form.
980.description: To establish a pilot program to implement an electronic prescription drug system and develop a standardized prior authorization form for use by insurance companies.

981.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
981.title: An Act Concerning A Basic Health Program.
981.description: To establish a basic health program providing coverage for persons under sixty-five years of age with family income up to two hundred per cent of the federal poverty level.

982.title: An Act Concerning Geographic Information Systems And Geospatial Information Systems Data Sharing.
982.description: To require electric and electric distribution companies to share certain geographic information systems data with municipalities.

983.title: An Act Concerning The Membership Of The Commission Of Pharmacy And Validating A Referendum.
983.description: To require that the Commission on Pharmacy's membership include one pharmacist from an independent retail setting and one from a chain retail setting and to require municipalities to redact Social Security numbers from documents or databases posted online, to validate a certain East Hartford referendum that was noticed improperly and to repeal various inactive boards and committees.

984.title: An Act Making Technical Revisions To Statutes Concerning The Treasurer.
984.description: To make technical revisions to statutes concerning the Treasurer.

985.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
985.title: An Act Concerning The Set-aside Program And The Percentage Of Contracts Reserved For Minority Business Enterprises.
985.description: To make technical changes to statutes concerning the Department of Administrative Services.

986.title: An Act Concerning The Office Of Governmental Accountability And The Freedom Of Information Commission.
986.description: To adjust the quorum number for the Freedom of Information Commission.

987.title: An Act Making A Technical Change To The Definition Of Governmental Function Under The Freedom Of Information Act.

988.title: An Act Making Technical Revisions To Statutes Concerning Notification Of The Secretary Of The State.

989.title: An Act Concerning Technical Revisions To The Code Of Ethics.
989.description: To make technical changes to the Code of Ethics for Public Officials.

990.title: An Act Concerning The State Elections Enforcement Commission.
990.description: To make technical corrections to the statute concerning the duties of the State Elections Enforcement Commission.

991.title: An Act Concerning Technical And Conforming Changes To Election Laws.
991.description: To make technical and conforming changes to election laws.

992.title: An Act Concerning Prescription Drug Monitoring.
992.description: To require health care practitioners to register for access to the electronic prescription drug monitoring program.

993.last_action: Senate Recommitted to Government Administration and Elections
993.title: An Act Concerning Changes To Elections Laws.
993.description: To permit the State Elections Enforcement Commission to investigate and initiate a proceeding of any registrar of voters guilty of misconduct, wilful and material neglect of duty or incompetence, to adjust the appointment process and terms of members of such commission, to provide that notice of removal from a registry list may be sent to committed felons in care of Department of Correction, to require the registrars of voters to verify as accurate any address of an applicant for an absentee ballot that differs from the applicant's address on the registry lists, to require enhanced training of registrars of voters and town clerks with regard to submission of official returns and to require town clerks to submit district maps in electronic format and to electronically file official returns, when possible.

994.title: An Act Concerning Technical Corrections To The Campaign Finance Statutes.
994.description: To make technical corrections to the campaign finance statutes.

995.title: An Act Concerning The Protection Of Municipal Records.
995.description: To require the Public Records Administrator to update regulations concerning fire-resistant vaults and safes to provide guidance on the protection of computer media and electronic records.

996.title: An Act Concerning Phosphorous Reduction In State Waters.
996.description: To make Clean Water Fund moneys available for municipal water pollution control projects concerning phosphorous removal.

997.title: An Act Concerning The Issuance Of Bonds For Municipal Sewerage Systems.
997.description: To make certain clarifications regarding the issuance of certain bonds secured by pledges of revenues.

998.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Finance, Revenue and Bonding
998.title: An Act Concerning The Prevention Of Urban Youth Delinquency And Violence.
998.description: To: (1) Establish a pilot program in the city of Hartford to inventory programs designed to reduce the number of youths who come into contact with the juvenile justice system; and (2) establish a Connecticut Young Adult Conservation Corps program.

999.title: An Act Concerning Illegal Electronic Monitoring.
999.description: To establish criminal penalties for electronic monitoring of a person when such electronic monitoring is conducted without legal authorization or consent of the person.

1000.title: An Act Concerning Intervention By Interested Third Parties In Controversies Involving Custody Of Minor Children.
1000.description: To delineate factors that the court shall consider when determining whether an interested third party shall be allowed to intervene into a matter involving custody of a minor child.

1001.title: An Act Concerning Liability For The Recreational Use Of Land.
1001.description: To amend the definition of "land" under the Recreational Land Use Act with respect to land owned by a municipality, political subdivision of the state, municipal corporation, special district or water or sewer district to exclude public beaches, boardwalks, designated spectator areas and structures, and paved sidewalks open to the public for pedestrian use.

1002.title: An Act Concerning The Amount Of Bond That May Be Set For Misdemeanor And Violation Offenses.
1002.description: To establish limitations on the amount of bond with surety that may be set as a condition of release for misdemeanor and violation offenses unless the court, judge, judge trial referee or bail commissioner makes specific factual findings as to why a greater amount of bond is necessary.

1003.last_action: Moved to Foot of the Calendar, Senate
1003.title: An Act Modernizing The State's Telecommunications Laws.
1003.description: To remove the requirements for telecommunications providers and telephone companies to file certain tariffs with the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority, to clarify for telecommunications companies when a document is considered filed, to eliminate the need for certain paper versions of filings and notifications, to clarify when audits are required, to change the process for withdrawal by a telephone company from providing a telecommunications service, to clarify the state's authority to regulate interconnected voice over Internet protocol service, to review certain video providers, to ensure funding for certain programming, to identify how certain funds provided for public access programming may be allocated, to enable out-of-state technicians to perform electrical work in the state during certain emergencies and to expand the areas in which telecommunications towers may be located.

1004.title: An Act Concerning Cable Television Equipment And The Disclosure Of Rates For Certain Services Offered By Telephone And Cable Companies.
1004.description: To require that each community antenna television company, holder of a certificate of cable franchise authority and holder of a certificate of video franchise authority provide an option for customers to buy any equipment for which such company or holder currently charges a monthly fee, and to require that each telephone company, community antenna television company, holder of a certificate of cable franchise authority and holder of a certificate of video franchise authority clearly identify pricing options on the web site of any such company or holder and on certain written materials.

1005.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1005.title: An Act Concerning Municipal Water Rates.
1005.description: To prevent certain municipal waterworks system rate increases of greater than ten per cent without approval from the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority.

1006.last_action: Favorable Report, Tabled for the Calendar, Senate
1006.title: An Act Concerning Energy Conservation And Renewable Energy, Energy Infrastructure Improvements, Energy Equipment Efficiency, Tree Trimming And Electric Vehicle Infrastructure.
1006.description: To reestablish a fuel oil conservation account; to require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to initiate a docket concerning gas distribution line extension; to create a natural gas vehicle pilot program; to require the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to examine the conversion of oil-heated buildings to natural gas and to increase the efficiency of heating oil use; to require the department to study barriers to participation by heating oil dealers in the promotion of energy efficiency programs; to require builders contracting for the construction of certain buildings to inform consumers of energy efficiency incentives; to require electric distribution companies to develop plans to strengthen electric infrastructure, including the development of renewable resources facilities; to modify statutes concerning tree trimming by utility companies; to encourage the use of micro-grids utilizing any combined heat and power system; to eliminate disparities between electric distribution companies concerning demand charges for geothermal systems; to exempt certain persons' use of electric distribution or transmission equipment from being considered electric distribution companies; to modify the requirements necessary to meet renewable energy portfolio standards compliance; to expand renewable energy source generation; to encourage electric vehicle use; to modify the funding provisions of the Home Energy Solutions program; to increase financial incentives for combined heat and power systems; and to fund the study of the regional independent system operator.

1007.title: An Act Concerning The Establishment Of A Heating Furnace And Boiler Replacement Program.
1007.description: To establish a heating furnace and boiler replacement program.

1008.title: An Act Concerning The Care And Treatment Of Persons With Psychiatric Disabilities.
1008.description: To enhance the care and treatment of persons with psychiatric disabilities in both inpatient and outpatient settings.

1009.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
1009.title: An Act Concerning Certificates Of Relief From Barriers Resulting From Conviction Of A Crime.
1009.description: To adopt the recommendations of the Connecticut Sentencing Commission regarding relief from barriers to employment, licensure and public housing for persons whose eligibility is limited due to prior conviction of a crime.

1011.last_action: Referred by Senate to Committee on Appropriations
1011.title: An Act Concerning The Commission On Human Rights And Opportunities.
1011.description: To (1) clarify the responsibilities and duties of the individual commissioners and staff of the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities, (2) extend certain statutory protections against discrimination to veterans and members of the armed forces and (3) require municipalities to comply with set-aside requirements for municipal projects funded by the state.

1012.title: An Act Concerning Harassment, Electronic Harassment And Cyberstalking.
1012.description: To clarify that harassment in the second degree may be deemed to have been committed at the place where the telephonic or electronic communication originated, and establish the offenses of electronic harassment and cyberstalking.

1013.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
1013.title: An Act Concerning A Cap On The Petroleum Products Gross Earnings Tax And Penalties For Abnormal Price Increases In Certain Petroleum Products.
1013.description: An Act Concerning A Cap On The Petroleum Products Gross Earnings Tax And Penalties For Abnormal Price Increases In Certain Petroleum Products.

1014.last_action: Transmitted to the Secretary of State
1014.title: An Act Concerning Educational Reform.
